The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more apricots to dry and sell

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr: bineta N. est parent beneficiaire et evolue dans la vente de draps de lit depuis sept ans.elle sollicite un credit de cent mille(100 000)frs pour diversifier ses articles afin de satisfaire sa clientele.avec son activite elle soutient son ,ari a entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Bineta N. is a recipient parent and has been developing her sales of bedding for seven years. She’s requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to diversify her merchandise in order to satisfy her customers. With her business, she supports her husband in taking care ofr her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Constance

texts.fr: Z. Constance est née le 22/10/1978 au Niger, un pays voisin du Bénin. Constance est mariée et mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Constance habite dans la maison de son père à Fifadji un quartier de Cotonou. Constance est allée à l’école mais n’a pas fini le cours primaire. C’est la couture que Constance a fini par apprendre comme métier. Cependant Constance n’a exercé ce métier que pour quelques années. C’est au commerce que Constance s’est finalement donnée. Constance avait vendu de la nourriture devant sa maison. Mais aujourd’hui, c’est des céréales, le maïs en particulier que Constance vend. Constance a eu déjà trois crédits de ALIDé pour ses activités. Constance sollicite ce quatrième prêt pour renforcer son fonds de roulement et accroître son activité de céréales.
texts.en:
Z. Constance was born on October 22, 1978 in Niger, a country neighboring Benin. She is married and the mother of two children who are both in school. She lives in her father’s house in Fifadji, a district of Cotonou. Constance attended school but did not finish primary school. Sewing is what she finally learned as her trade. Yet she worked in this trade for only a few years and finally came to devote all her time to commerce. She used to sell food in front of her house. But today, it’s grains, corn in particular. Constance has already had three different ALIDé business loans. She’s requesting this fourth loan for bolstering her working capital and for growing her business in grains.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy four 100-kg sacks of corn

loans.name: Mrs. Vorn Sok Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of six people who all live in Smaong Village in Takeo province. Mrs. Vorn S. is the group leader.

Mrs. Vorn S. is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare (5-acre) field on which she cultivates rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Phan Thob, is a duck breeder. In this business, he now faces a small problem because he does not have enough money to buy duck food to feed his ducks. Thus, Mrs. Vorn S. decided to ask for a loan to buy duck food for her husband’s business.

Mrs. Vorn S. is 37 years old and is the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school while the other one stays at home to help the parents with housework.

loans.use: To buy duck food for her husband's business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is married to Rex and they were blessed with four children. The couple is living in Bacnor East, Burgos, Isabela, with their children. They are managing a simple business, which is a vehicle-repair shop that serves to provide for the educational needs of their children. Her dreams is for her children to finish their studies for she believes that education is the key to progress. She is glad that aside from their repair shop, her husband is also managing a farm for an alternative source of income.  

She is now in need of additional capital for the maintenance of her repair-shop business. For this, she is asking for a loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos from Kiva lenders. The loan will greatly help her to maintain their small repair shop.

loans.use: Additional capital for the maintenance of her business

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario N. is 46 years old, and her partner now is Eugenio Garcia, 58 years old, with whom she has found true happiness. They were blessed with one child, Mark Lester, 12 years old. From her former unsuccessful marriage, she has two children, Rose Anne, 20 years old, and Rogelyn, 16 years old, for whom she is still responsible.

One source of their income comes from the salary of Eugenio, working as a foreman carpenter. The three children are currently studying so creating more expenses, especially her two older children who are in college. Rosario helps Eugenio in providing for their family through the income from buying and selling various frozen foods. Sometimes she sells some beauty products, and also offers her customers pedicures or manicures, treatment for their hair, a spa for their feet, and facial treatments.

Her 7th loan from Kiva field partner Ahon sa Hirap Inc. (ASHI) is will be used in buying what is needed for these businesses: frozen foods and beauty products and for her other business, nail polish, things used in treating hair, face, and feet. She is sure after buying all this, she will get a big boost in income because these are all the things that help her in improving her businesses.

The education of her children is her priority in life, so she will do everything to make her businesses grow. One dream of hers is to have a beauty salon where they live so she can always afford the educational expenses of her children.

loans.use: To finance all her businesses

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia L. is from the village of Talakag , Bukidnon. She is 49 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Lilia owns and operates a business buying and selling different vegetables around the village. Lilia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Lilia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lilia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz, de 37 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Juan, de 38 años; y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida.

Su negocio está ubicado en el mercado Las Mercedes (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), ella se dedica a la venta de papayas, las cuales su esposo trae desde la ciudad de Puerto Maldonado (ciudad que limita con el país de Brasil). Su puesto es muy concurrido, pues las papayas que vende son frescas y muy jugosas, lo cual ha hecho que tenga muchos clientes.
Lo que más le gusta a Luz de su negocio es conversar con sus vecinas de venta, ya que así hace más amenas sus largas jornadas de venta, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día en su puesto sin poder salir a ningún lado. Espera que con el tiempo su negocio crezca y le pueda brindar mejores ingresos.

Este es el noveno préstamo de Luz con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otros créditos posteriormente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. Los dos mil soles que ahora solicita los invertirá en la compra de más papayas, para así implementar mejor la mercadería de su negocio.
texts.en:
Luz, 37, is a very hard-working woman who lives with her husband, Juan, 38, in their own home. Her greatest desire is to improve their quality of life. She sells papayas in the Las Mercedes (Juliaca's most important market) market. Her husband brings the papayas from the city of Puerto Maldonado (a city on the Brazilian border). Her stand is very popular because her papayas are fresh and juicy and this has attracted many customers. What Luz most likes about her job is being able to chat with her fellow merchants because that makes the long work days much more pleasant. She has been in this line of work for 8 years and considers the most difficult part of it having to stay at her post all day long not being able to go out anywhere. She hopes that, in time, her business will grow and produce better earnings. This is Luz's 9th loan with MFP. She knows that she must make all her repayments on time if she wants to have access to future loans and she is willing to do so. The 2000 soles requested will be used to buy more papayas in order to have better selection of merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase stock inventory.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is fifty-one years old. She is married and has four children who are all in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Axim. Axim is along the coast in the western region of Ghana and fishing is the major occupation of the people there.

Grace is a trader. She trades food items such as maize, cassava, etc. She buys these items from nearby communities and treks to sell them in other nearby towns. She has been a trader for ten years and wants a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy food items to trade

loans.name: Leizel

texts.en: Leizel C. is from the village of Biasong. She is 29 years old and is married. Leizel owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2009, Leizel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Penda Aliou

texts.fr: Penda Aliou KÂ est âgée de 38 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants . Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SIWAL depuis 2 ans et a eu à y bénéficié de 4 prêts qu'elle a remboursés. Avec son prêt elle développe un petit élevage de bœufs et de moutons et les bénéfices issus de son activité lui permettent d'aider à la prise en charge familiale et de renforcer son niveau d'épargne.
texts.en:
Penda Aliou KÂ is 38 years old, married and has six children. She has been a member of the village bank in SIWAL for two years and has had four loans which she has repaid. With her loan she is building up a small beef and sheep rearing business and the profits from her activity will allow her to help taking care of her family and to boost her savings.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthening her self-financing capacity

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Antonio V. esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual le ayudo a poner el techo en una parte de su casa. 
Nuevamente esta solicitando su cooperación para este nuevo crédito, para colocar el techo de madera en mejor condición  poner el techo en la otra parte de la cocina y salas de la casa.
Planea pagar el crédito con una partes del ingreso es el que obtiene de árbitro en un campo de deportes, ya que es la fuente de ingresos de su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Antonio V. is grateful for your cooperation in the previous loan. It helped him put a roof over a part of his house. He is asking for your cooperation again for this new loan to place a wooden roof in better condition; to put on a roof on the other part of the kitchen and rooms of the house. He plans on paying for the loan with parts of his income he receives as a referee at the sports field. This is his family's source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of the wooden roof

loans.name: Chorn's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chorn K. is a villager from Rumchek village, Takeo province. She is 48 years old and the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by AMK, a Kiva partner. With the loans, they will buy supplies, equipment and other items for different purposes.
 
Mrs. Chorn K. is a farmer and also a silk weaver who receives a small income to support her family. For the silk-weaving business, she wants to take a loan of 600,000 Riel from AMK to buy more silk to support her business activities. Mrs. Chorn K. is a widow with three children, one of whom is a seamstress, while another is a silk weaver and the last one is a student in the public school.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Camino Al Exito Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal “CAMINO AL EXITO”, actualmente se encuentra en el IV ciclo y esta conformado por 14 personas trabajadoras que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, es un banco comunal conformado por socios que viven en la provincia D. Cusco del departamento Cusco.  Cusco es una cuidad que se caracteriza por su Centro Histórico, sus paisajes, su historia siendo una ciudad encantadora D. la Región Sur del país. 

Las actividades económicas D. los socios a las que se dedican son el comercio como por ejemplo venta D. comestibles, venta D. comida, venta D. golosinas, venta D. ropa, venta D. leña, venta D. artesanía, venta D. bebidas alcohólicas y venta D. útiles escolares y otros brindan servicios D. transporte y servicio D. cocina. El banco comunal tiene varios ciclos D. funcionamiento, como manifiestan las socias, se encuentran contentas y satisfechas con los servicios D. crédito, ahorro y capacitación, por el tiempo D. permanencia en el banco comunal un aspecto D. valoración es el ahorro por la posibilidad D. capitalización que les brinda este servicio. 

Hirazema es socia del banco comunal Camino al Éxito, tiene 39 años D. edad, es soltera y aun no tiene hijos. La socia trabaja en la ONG  “Bartolomé D. las Casas” en la ciudad del Cusco como consejera D. limpieza, su labor como empleada empieza a las 7am hasta las 9am y D. 5pm hasta 7:30pm todos los días. Hirazema es una mujer emprendedora que tiene un pequeño negocio D. confección D. ropa D. lana como por ejemplo chompas, ponchos, chalinas y chulos. La socia requiere el crédito D. los 600 soles para comprar 100 madejas D. lana.
Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Camino al Exito” (Road to Success) is currently starting its fourth loan cycle and consists of 14 hardworking individuals who view each moment as an opportunity to get ahead. Through their daily efforts, they are able to proviD. a better future for their children. The members of the Communal Bank live in the Province and Department of Cusco. Cusco is a city known for its Historical Center, its landscapes, and its history for being one of the most enchanting cities in the southern part of the country.

The business activities of the members incluD. selling groceries, food, candy, clothing, firewood, handicrafts, alcoholic beverages, school supplies, or services such as transportation and catering. The Communal Bank has participated in various loan cycles and the members are content and satisfied with the loans, savings, and training sessions. One ongoing aspect of the Communal Bank that is of value is the group savings account that opens the possibility for building up assets, which is what this service provides.

Hirazema is a member of the Communal Bank “Camino al Exito”. She is 39 years old, single, and does not have children. She works for the NGO “Bartolomé D. las Casas” in the city of Cusco as a janitor. Her cleaning duties are performed between 7am to 9am and from 5pm to 7:30pm every day. Hirazema is an enterprising woman who has a small business producing clothing maD. of wool such as sweaters, ponchos, scarves, and caps. She is requesting a loan of 600 PEN in order to buy 100 skeins of wool.

The members are grateful for this opportunity and commit to making their payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy S. is from the village of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 30 years old, is married, and has two school-aged children. Mercy owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling dried fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Mercy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Mercy is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 7th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with a teenage son. She is an entrepreneur from Beregovo where she sells children’s clothing merchandise in the local market called “Image”.

Irina is very customer-friendly and polite with all of her clients. She has been in this business for six years. Currently, Irina has 22,000 Grivnyas in inventory and her profit amounts to 8,000 Grivnyas a month.

Irina is requesting a 3,500 Grivnya loan to purchase additional merchandise. Her business is constantly growing and she can hardly handle the high demand she’s facing now. She realizes that lending services are very helpful to her business, as loans allow her to increase her turnover capital and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es:
Juan Alberto forma parte del banco comunal “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA”, tiene 45 años, es conviviente y tiene cuatro hijos. Juan Alberto trabaja en una empresa donde producen tejas y ladrillos y su esposa trabaja vendiendo papas en el mercado de Huancaro de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que trabajan en el negocio de venta de papas y les va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en el trabajo. 

Juan Alberto es un joven trabajador y emprendedor que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un  mejor futuro a sus hijos, el requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio y desea comprar más semillas. 
           
El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente. La comunidad de Inquilpata se encuentra a una hora y diez minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.
texts.en:
Juan Alberto, 45, is a member of “VIRGEN MARIA DE INQUILPATA” (Virgin Mary of Inquilpata) communal bank; he lives with his partner and their four children. Juan Alberto works for a firm that manufactures bricks and ceiling tiles; his wife works as a potato merchant in Cusco’s Huancaro market. They have been potato farmers for quite some time now and they do well thanks to the effort they put into their work. Juan Alberto is a hard-working, enterprising young man who is always looking for ways to provide the best for his family and to get ahead in life through his own daily efforts. He needs funds to buy more seed. He is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion. Inquilpata is an hour and 10 minutes away from the city of Cusco.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed.

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina C. is from the village of Upper Dicayas. She is 50 years old, married, and has 6 school-aged children. Carolina owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling a variety of fish in the local community. Carolina has been involved in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2006, Carolina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Carolina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Carolina is requesting a new loan, her 8th, of 7,000 PHP, which will be used for house repair and additional capital for her fishing business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: for house repair and additional capital for her fishing business

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin S. is from the village of Sinonoc, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Jasmin is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Jasmin owns & operates a business venture making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Jasmin is just starting this business.

In 2006, Jasmin joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jasmin has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Jasmin is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the second loan taken out by Jasmin from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Pierrette

texts.fr: K. Pierrette est née le 29 Juin 1974 et est marié à AGUINDE Gilbert, un tailleur. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois sont à leur charge. Pierrette vit depuis sept ans au quartier Djeffa, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji, avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple subvient ensemble aux besoins de la famille. Pierrette n’a fréquenté que l’école primaire. Depuis cinq ans, Pierrette vend des friperies à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Cette activité lui procure des revenus l’aidant à faire face à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. Pierrette s’approvisionne au marché de Missèbo à Cotonou. C’est la première fois que Pierrette sollicite un concours financier de ALIDé, afin de renforcer son capital et d’agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
K. Pierrette was born on June 29, 1974 and is married to AGUINDE Gilbert, a tailor. The couple have five children, all enrolled in school, of whom three still depend on their parents. For seven years, Pierrette has been living in the Djeffa neighborhood, in the township of Sèmè-Podji, with her children and her husband. The couple share the task of supporting their family. Pierrette only attended primary school. For five years, she has been selling used clothing in Dantokpa, the international market of Bénin. This business brings in income that allows her to support herself and the children. She buys her goods in the Missèbo market in Cotonou. It is the first time that Pierrette is requesting a loan from ALIDé, in order to increase her working capital and expand her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of used clothing

loans.name: Puthy's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Puthy Y. 42 years old and is the group leader, having been selected by its five members located in Preak Tapov village, Kandal province. She is a farmer who works very hard to support her family's costs of living. Her husband, a motorbike taxi driver, is able to earn a small income to support his family's living expenses. Mrs. Puthy Y. now is requesting for a loan to dig a well and to pay for laborers to plow her farm so that she can grow corn, pumpkin and vegetables. This couple does not have any children.

loans.use: To dig a well and to pay for laborers to plow her farm to grow corn and pumpkin.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn L. is from the town of Pob. Sinacaban, Mis. Occ. She is 35 years old. Merlyn is married and has three children. To make a living, Merlyn owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Merlyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en: Oeun Y. is a domestic farmer who plants various crops to earn a living and typically generates an income of $2.5 per day. Her husband also goes to work in the field with her. This couple is married but does not have any children yet. Oeun Y. lacks funds to support her in her farm trade so she would like to seek a Kiva loan in the amount of US$400 in order to buy fertilizer, insecticide, a pump, and seed for planting.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, insecticide, a pump, and seed for planting.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth P. is from the village of Gumbil, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 40 years old. Janeth is married and has three school-aged children. Janeth owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Janeth has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Janeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from PMPC, which was for 7,400 PHP and was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Janeth is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This loan will be her fourth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Mery

texts.en: Mery M. is single. She has junior high level of education. Mery is a seamstress and sells panties and underwear at Elmina. Mery uses her income to take care of herself. Mery will use the loan to purchase more panties and underwear for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mery plans to save to revive her sewing business.

loans.use: purchase more panties and underwear for sale

loans.name: Víctor Manuel

texts.es: El Sr. Víctor Manuel E.   él  se dedica a la agricultura de granos, tiene Cuarenta y dos años de dedicarse a esta actividad es casado actualmente. Ha tenido  cuatro  créditos con CEPRODEL y los ha realizado para comprar insumos para preparar el terreno para ayudarse en su siembra, y aumentar los rendimientos en sus cultivos de granos básicos y por lo consiguiente aumentar los ingresos de la unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Víctor Manuel E. dedicates himself to growing basic grains.  He has been a farmer for forty-two years, and is currently married.

He has had four loans with CEPRODEL, which he has used to buy supplies to prepare his soil for planting and increase the yield of his grain crops.  In turn, this helps him increase the income for his family.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Ophelia R., from the village of Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental, is 34 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Ophelia owns and operates a business venture offering motor transport services. Engaged in her business for over a year, she earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Ophelia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC, she is now requesting her second loan of 15000 PHP to repair an existing vehicle for better service. Ophelia plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy B. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Sta. Cruz, Brgy. Don Virgilio, Medellin, Cebu. She earns her living by operating one business venture: a fishing / fish vending business.  Her husband Vicente B., who is 50 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have nine children who are 4 to 19 years old.  One of their children has their own family. Another one works and the other seven are currently going to school. 

Judy joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Judy has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,900, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 5th loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000 which she intends to use to buy fishnet so that she can continue to save up for the future and the business. 

Judy B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

 About NWTF: 

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Komlavi

texts.fr: K. a 29 ans.  Il exerce comme activité la vente de porcs que lui-même élève.  Il a remboursé plusieurs  crédits  déjà grâce à cette activité.  Pour nourrir les porcs, il achète leur bétail à Gleyi pour les satisfaire  et compte dans cette activité 4 ans déjà. Il sollicite ce prêt pour acheter leurs  nourritures et se réapprovisionner.
texts.en: K. is 29 years old. His activity consists in rearing and selling pigs. He has taken out and repaid several loans for this activity. He buys pig feed in Gleyi. He has been in this trade for 4 years already. He applies for this loan to buy pig feed and stock up.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Ombui

texts.en:
Ombui A., 72, is married, and has eight children, ages of 30 to 45.  He has been farming for the past fifteen years and sells products such as tea, bananas, maize and milk at the local market.

This will be his first loan through Juhudi Kilimo and he plans to use it to purchase a dairy cow.  In the next five years, he hopes to grow more bananas and have a total of five dairy cows.

With the anticipated increase in profits, he hopes to improve the food availability for his family and increase their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Marvin

texts.en:
Marvin E. is from the town of Talibon. He is 23 years old. Marvin is married and has a 4-month-old child. To make a living, Marvin operates a fishing boat to catch and sell assorted fish to the market. 

Marvin joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marvin has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Marvin is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets

loans.name: Diakaridia

texts.fr:
Monsieur Diakaridia D.  est un homme marié de 45 ans monogame et père de neuf  enfants, vivant   dans le quartier Ouest de Kolondièba ( préfecture ) dans une  famille nucléaire,   dans la troisième région (Sikasso) de la république du  Mali. 
Pour mieux alléger sa pauvreté, Monsieur D. adhéra au programme de prêt individuel de stockage et commercialisation de céréales de Soro Yiriwaso. Il  est à son premier prêt.
Avec ce prêt, il compte acheter, 10 tonnes de maïs et qu’il stockera pour revendre en un moment où le prix sera plus intéressant au marché de Kolondièba. En plus du stockage commercialisation des céréales Monsieur Diakaridia fait aussi achat et vente de beurre de karité. Il s’approvisionne dans  les  villages environnants et envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de  35. 000 FCFA. .Ce bénéfice sera utilisé dans les frais scolaire des enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Diakaridia D. is a 45-year old man, married and living in a monogamous family, with nine children. He lives in the Ouest district of the Kolondièba Prefecture with his nuclear family, in the third region (the Sikasso Region) of Mali.

In order to alleviate his poverty, Mr. D. joined the Soro Yiriwaso program of individual loan for stocking and selling cereals. He is on his first loan. With this loan he plans to purchase 10 tons of corn, which he will stock until the  prices for corn go up at the  Kolondièba market. In addition to selling cereals, Mr. Diakarida also resells shea butter. He stocks up in the nearby villages. He plans to achieve an average monthly income of 35,000 West African francs. This income will be used towards the school fees of his children.

loans.use: Purchasing cereals

loans.name: Champion Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe CHAMPION sont toutes mariés avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles monogames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur troisième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, les prêts passé ont été remboursé dans de bonne condition. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de condiments  à travers KADIATOU T.. 
KADIATOU T.  compte acheter avec son  prêt, 5 paniers de tomates , 4 paquets de cube maggi. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de SIKASSO.
Les condiments sont revendus au  marché de SANOUBOUGOU I à Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant. 
 Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 70.000FCFA utilisée pour les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The five members of the group name Champion are all married and they have an average age of 37.  They are 4 children each and the majority lives in monogamous families in Sanoubougou I, one of the quarters in the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). 

They are on their third group loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso (Kiva Field Partner) and their goal is to satisfy client demand. Their past loans have all successfully been repaid. This group of women sells condiments through Kadiatou T.. 

Kadiatou T. plans on investing her loan in the purchase of 5 baskets of tomatoes and 4 packages of Maggi cubes. She makes her purchases in the large market in Sikasso. 

The condiments are resold in the market in Sanoubougou I in Sikasso, to family and to a clientele made of men and women. She completes her sales in cash. 

She expects to earn a monthly income of 70.000 FCFA which will be used to cover her family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: To purchase condiments.

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Man M. sells a few wares, such as soft drinks, sweets for children, various cakes and cooking supplies, in front of her house. Her husband is a furniture maker, producing beds, cupboards and tables to meet the family’s living expenses. This couple has six children; two of them are married and four are single.

Man M.'s son, who is a fisherman, wishes to buy a lot of small fish to feed and then sell in order to earn additional income. Man M. really wants to encourage her son to achieve his goal, but she doesn't have enough money to make it possible. Therefore, Man M. would like to request a Kiva loan for her son to purchase small fish in bigger amounts.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of small fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María forma parte del Banco comunal “Luz de esperanza” perteneciente a la ciudad de Curicó. Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio ambulante, ya que vende artículos de menaje (loza), juguetes, plantas (cactus) y principalmente ropa usada y nueva. El lugar donde vende sus artículos es en una feria libre.
María trabajó durante 33 años en el sector público como técnico paramédico, sin embargo sufrió un accidente vascular que la mantuvo sin caminar durante mucho tiempo, debido a esto recibe una pensión de invalidez. En la actualidad se encuentra muy bien de salud y recibe tratamiento médico. Debido a esto, que desde hace 3 años se dedica al rubro del comercio ambulante.
Su mercadería, principalmente la ropa, la compra en Santiago en locales mayoristas, para abaratar costos. Y en Curicó compra artículos de menaje y plantas. Durante la temporada escolar correspondiente al mes de marzo, sus ganancias son altas.
Es por esto que el crédito de fondo esperanza lo utilizará para comprar ropa de colegio, específicamente calcetas, pantalones, buzos y ropa interior.
María vive con su hija quien también trabaja, por lo que existe otro ingreso económico en el hogar.
El sueño de María es tener un local establecido en el cual pueda vender sus artículos para que mejoren sus ingresos y así tener una  vida más confortable. Y es este también el motivo de continuar trabajando en el rubro.
Para María los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza han sido un gran apoyo para su negocio, ya que le dan facilidades para cancelar su crédito. También disfruta mucho de las reuniones que realiza Fondo Esperanza, ya que ha conocido gente muy buena con la que ha generado lazos de amistad. 
Curicó se ubica en la región del Maule, zona centro del país. El clima de Curicó es de tipo mediterráneo y es considerado como uno de los más agradables del país. Se caracteriza además por su cultura en torno al vino y sus alrededores de belleza natural.  A pesar de que la fuerza de trabajo se ha  incrementado, esta zona sigue siendo, según el último censo, una de las más pobres del país.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the Luz de Esperanza communal bank that is in the city of Curicó. 

She works as a street vendor selling articles of the home (dishes) toys, plants (cactus) but mostly used and new clothes.  She sells at an open market.  Maria worked for 33 years in the public sector as a paramedic.  She had a vascular accident that kept her from walking for a long time and because of this she received a disability pension.  Currently she is healthy and receives medical treatment.  Three years ago she started working as a street vendor.  She buys most of her merchandise, mostly clothing, from wholesalers in Santiago to keep costs down.  And in Curicó she buys house wares and plants.  During the school season in March, she does very well.
She will use the loan to buy school clothes, specifically knitted items, pants, gym clothes and underwear.  Maria lives with her daughter who also works, and this gives the home another source of income.

Maria’s dream is to have a permanent stall where she can sell her products to improve her earnings and have a more comfortable life.  And this is also her reason to continue working in her business.
For Maria the financing terms from Fondo Esperanza have been a great support for her business since they allow her to pay off her loans.  She also enjoys the meetings at Fondo Esperanza and she has meet very good people with whom she has become friends. 

Curicó is in the Maule region, in the center of the country.  The climate is Mediterranean and Curicó is thought to be one of the most pleasant areas of the country.  It is also known for its wines and beautiful surroundings.  
Despite the increase in work in the area, it is still, according to the last census, one of the poorest in the country.

loans.use: To buy school clothing, specifically knitted items, pants, gym clothes, and underwear

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 38 años, es una mujer muy amable y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su querida hija María de 15 años y está dispuesta a trabajar muy duro para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La tienda de Sonia es la primera en abrirse en su pueblo, desde las 6 de la mañana sus puertas ya están listas para recibir a sus madrugadores compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su tienda no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su pueblo, lleva 10 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir. Con el tiempo, anhela hacer crecer su negocio y brindarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio. Este es el noveno crédito con MFP y espera poder pagar a tiempo sus cuotas, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
Sonia, age 38, is a kind and cheerful woman. She lives in her own home with her beloved 15 year old daughter María. Sonia is willing to work hard so that she can provide her daughter a better quality of life. Her store was one of the first to open in her town. At 6am, the doors of her store are open to receive the early morning buyers who have no hesitation to buy because they are aware of the variety of goods that she offers. Her customers have the security of knowing that they can find everything they need. What she enjoys most about her job is conversing with her customers and getting news about the events in town. Sonia has been in this business for ten years and considers the most difficult part to be staying at her store all day without being able to leave. Within time, she hopes to grow her business and provide her customers with better service.

This is her ninth loan with MFP. Sonia expects to submit her payments on time because she does not want to cause problems for the other members of her Communal Bank. She is a highly respected member because she tries to keep her group orderly. The loan of 500 PEN that she requested will be used to buy more products so that her store will be better stocked.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary A. is 42 years old, from Kisumu, married to Charles.  They have six children who are all in school.

Rosemary has been running a grocery business for the past year. She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by a friend and is applying for her first loan. Rosemary will use the loan to buy bananas, sugarcane, carrots and eggs to add to her stock. The profits made will be used to educate her children.

She hopes to own a big grocery shop in the future and venture into a cereals business. Rosemary also plans to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy beans, bananas, sugarcane, carrots and eggs to add to her stock.

loans.name: Ana Ysabel

texts.es: La Sra. Ana, tiene como actividad la venta de diversos productos en su tienda de barrio donde vive. El destino del crédito en esta oportunidad es para la compra de mercadería "compra de abarrotes" como fideo, azúcar, arroz, aceite, etc. La familia de la cliente esta compuesta por su esposo y su pequeña hija, el esposo el   Sr. Néstor trabaja como operador de maquinaria pesada en el interior de país , es una familia relativamente joven muy responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana sells various products in her store in the neighborhood where she lives. She will use this loan to purchase merchandise such as noodles sugar, rice, oil, etc. 

Ana is married and has a young daughter. Her husband, Néstor, works as a heavy machinery operator in the center of the country. Hers is a relatively young family that is very responsible with a strong desire to get ahead and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as noodles, sugar, rice, oil, etc.

loans.name: Nakato

texts.en:
Nakato D. is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has eight children, one of whom is currently in school. Nakato has a business selling sand and soil for housebuilding, and she has run this business for four years.
To help expand her business, Nakato has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more sand and soil (for building houses) for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Nakato hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sand and soil for resale.

loans.name: Germanita

texts.en:
Germanita is from the village of Talisay, Gingoog City. She is 75 years old. Germanita is married and has one adult child. 

To make a living, Germanita sells ready-to-wear clothing, detergents and shoe products. Germanita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Germanita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Germanita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Germanita is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional blouses and t-shirts. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Germanita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional blouses and t-shirts for resale.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es: Yanet, de 38 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Severo de 40 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, en el caserío de Picoy. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, Yanet comienza con el cuidado de sus tierras, ya que sabe que de la calidad de productos como la  papa y las arvejas dependerán las ganancias que obtenga por su venta. Sus cultivos los lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, ya que es donde mejores precios obtiene. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras, lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad junto a su esposo y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos. Con el tiempo, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para ampliar su producción. Por otro lado ha incursionado en la venta de ropa y adornos realizados a base de materiales reciclables como botellas, cajas palos de chupetes y demás. Los cuales vende en un puesto de comercio, ubicado en el mercado modelo de la ciudad de Tarma. Donde además está planeando realizar cerámica este mes, con la buena disposición que tiene y la creatividad innata que la caracteriza está segura que tendrá éxito.  Por tanto espera de su apoyo para continuar con su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Exaltación Santa Cruz” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, por lo que espera su colaboración para lograr sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Yanet, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de un pequeño horno para la realización de las cerámicas que empezará a fabricar con objetos reciclables y además de comprar mercadería de ropa variada.
texts.en:
Yanet, 38, is a down-to-earth and hardworking woman.  She lives in her own house with her husband Severo, 40, and their 3 children, in the village of Picoy.  Early every morning, Yanet goes out to work in her fields, since she knows that the prices she gets for the vegetables she grows (such as potatoes and peas) depend on the quality of her products.  She sells her products at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma, where she can get the best price for them. She loves cultivating her land and has been doing it with her husband for 25 years.  The hardest part is transporting the products to market.  Over time, she would like buy more land so as to increase her production.  She has also begun selling clothing and accessories made from recyclable materials, such as bottles, boxes, popsicle sticks, and so on.  She sells these at a stall in the indoor market in Tarma. She is also planning to start making ceramics this month, and she is sure to succeed, thanks to her good character and her innate creativity.  

Yanet counts on your support to continue her work.  She is a member of the “Exaltación Santa Cruz” community bank, and this is her fourth loan with MFP.  She once again promises to meet her payments on time.  She is glad to be part of the community bank because all the members are responsible and friendly people.  Yanet will use the money she is requesting to buy a small kiln for the ceramics that she is starting to make with recycled objects, as well as to buy various kinds of clothing to sell.

loans.use: to buy a kiln and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy embroidery material.

loans.name: Dania Maria

texts.en:
Dania lives in the town of Danli in southern Honduras where she makes a living by selling freshly prepared food. Her business has done well over recent years due to its convenient location near a gas station as well as thanks to Dania’s hard work. 

Due to the increase in business, Dania now employs an assistant to help her with the food preparation. Dania is requesting a loan of Lps. 10,000 to purchase ingredients for cooking.

loans.use: This loan will be used to purchase chicken, beef, eggs, cheese, rice, beans, plantains, cornmeal, butter, cooking oil, carrots, onion, tomatoes, and lettuce.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children. 

Leonora has a retail shop that sells afritada (a chicken dish) and caldereta (a stew). She has had this business for three years. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy raw ingredients for cooking dishes.

Leonora is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for cooking dishes

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 46 years old and married with two children aged 11 and 12. She runs a provision store in Goderich, a neighborhood in Freetown. She also takes care of relatives as well as immediate family.
Kadiatu sells biscuits, Ovaltine, candles, chocolates and soft drinks at her store. She has owned this business for five years. Kadiatu also receives income from her husband. She says that her foodstuffs business is doing well.
Kadiatu requested this loan through Kiva partner, BRAC Sierra Leone, to purchase more provisions such as eggs, milk, biscuits and chocolates. Kadiatu says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her savings and improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more provisions such as eggs, milk, biscuits and chocolates.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar, age 51, is a farmer from the village of Pirveli Sviri. She and her husband Zurab earn a living through a family agricultural business. Specifically, they have three milk cows, three calves and a bull. Tamar produces cheese from the milk and sells it at the local market. The family also has three pigs. They sell approximately 30 piglets per year. Along with keeping domestic animals, Tamar and Zurab own one hectare of land, where they grow various fruits and vegetables. They sell the harvested produce at the local market as well. 

Tamar has requested a loan in order to purchase an additional milk cow. In this way, she will be able to increase the production and sale of cheese and their monthly income will increase. Tamar and Zurab plan to reinvest the received profit into a further expansion of their agricultural business.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Randy

texts.en:
Randy is married. He is thirty-six years old and lives in Happy Valley, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur.

Randy sells pigs to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month, he earns fifty thousand Philippine pesos (PHP) per harvest doing this type of business. He has requested a loan for 35,000 PHP to purchase feeds for her pigs.

Randy has been a member of PMPC for almost three (3) years. In the future, Randy hopes to earn more income for the success of his business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for her pigs

loans.name: Télésphore

texts.fr:
Télésphore fait le  commerce ambulant. Il est né au Rwanda et a 30 ans. Il est célibataire 

C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit pour acheter des tôles, des clous, et payement de main d’œuvre pour la construction de la toiture de sa maison. 

Dans les prochaines années, Télésphore voudrait avoir une grande boutique et être un importateur.  Il prévoit de construire d'autres appartements à louer et fonder un foyer.
texts.en:
Télésphore makes a living through door-to-door sales. He was born in Rwanda and is 30 years old and single. 

This is the first loan he has sought with ACB. He will use the loan in order to buy sheet metal, nails, and to pay the labour costs for the construction of a roof for his home. 

In the years to come, Télésphore would like to own a large shop for imports.  His aim is to build some apartments that he will rent out, and also to build a home.

loans.use: to purchase sheet metal and nails, and to pay labour costs for the construction of the roof of his home

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en:
Sonia is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with six children. 

Sonia has a retail shop that sells generic medicines like Paracetamol & Ambroxol. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy generic medicines for sale.

Sonia is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Sonia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy generic medicines for sale.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a single woman with two children who attend school. She lives in a rental house with electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for her family and school fees for her children. 

Grace has operated a business selling tea leaves for the past three years; her potential clients are her friends, neighbors and relatives. She faces a major challenge of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business. Grace plans to use this KES 20,000 loan to purchase tea leaves for sale. She decided to join Yehu because of low loan interest rates.

loans.use: To purchase tea leaves for sale.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is 46 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. For the past nine years, Irene has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which serves hot meals to local customers. 

To help expand her business, Irene has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food supplies, and will help Irene to generate greater profits and improve her family's quality of life. Irene hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another restaurant in town. 

Irene is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Irene who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more food supplies

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Brenda has a retail shop that sells food supplements, cosmetics, detergents, and clothes from GOOD FAITH products. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy stocks from GOOD FAITH to sell.

Brenda is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Brenda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks from GOOD FAITH to sell

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria pertenece al banco comunal “Tesoritos del Manu” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Salvación provincia de Manu departamento de Madre de Dios. 

Gregoria tiene 57 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, ella nació en la ciudad Puno y desde hace 40 años que vive en la ciudad de Salvación y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Su principal actividad económica de Gregoria es la venta de helados de forma ambulatoria. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

En esta oportunidad Gregoria requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo azúcar, frutas y otras cosas más.    

Gregoria agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Gregoria belongs to the “Tesoritos del Manu” communal bank, which meets once a month in the town of Salvación, in Manú province, in Madre de Dios department. Gregoria, 57, is in a common-law relationship, and has five children. She was born in the city of Puno, and has been living in the town of Salvación for 40 years, where she makes her living.  

Gregoria's main livelihood is selling ice cream on the street.  She has been in this business for several years now, and it's going well, thanks to the effort she puts into her work. On this occasion, Gregoria needs the loan to buy ingredients such as sugar, fruit, and other things.  

Gregoria values and appreciates the loan, and is committed to making her monthly instalment payments.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as sugar, fruit, and other things for making ice cream.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: La Sra. Mercedes se dedica a la venta de comida, vive con sus dos hijos en la zona de Pampahasi que esta ubicado a veinticinco minutos del centro de la ciudad. Ella esta separada de su esposo pero a pesar de esto es una mujer muy trabajadora que anhela que sus hijas lleguen a ser profesionales algún día.  La Sra. Mercedes tenía su casita en la zona de Valle de las Flores debido a que hubo un deslizamiento de tierra en esa zona varias familias incluida la de ella perdieron sus casitas y todas sus pertenecías,  ahora vive en alquiler desde hace ya ocho meses. Ella quiere poder ahorrar lo suficiente para poder en algún momento volver a comprar una casita. Siendo su actividad principal es la venta de comida, vende almuerzo cada día y también platos especiales en fin de semana como ser la sajta de pollo y thimpu de res. Es esta oportunidad mercedes solicita el préstamo de dinero para la compra de insumos como fideo, arroz, aji, como también  harina y otros abarrotes ya que su otra actividad es la venta de víveres a crédito los cuales reparte entre sus conocidas de la zona.
texts.en:
Sra. Mercedes sells food. She lives with her two children in the District of Pampahasi, which is located 25 minutes from the central part of the city. Despite being separated from her husband, Mercedes is a hardworking woman who wants her daughters to become professionals someday. She owned a small house in the District of Valle de Las Flores, but she along with other families lost their homes and all of their possessions in a landslide. Mercedes now lives in a rental property that she has occupied for the past eight months. She wants to save enough money so that she can buy another house someday.

Her main business activity is selling food. She sells lunches every day and also offers special dishes on the weekend such as “sajta de pollo” (spicy stewed chicken) and “thimpu de res” (beef and potatoes in a garlic sauce). Mercedes is taking this opportunity to request a loan and will use the money to buy supplies such as noodles, rice, garlic, flour, and products for her other business of selling groceries on credit. She delivers these products to her friends in the neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business and merchandise for her grocery business.

loans.name: Pura

texts.en:
Pura is 63 years old, married, and has 10 children.  She lives in the Philippines. Pura has a shop that sells beauty products from Avon such as perfumes and lotions. She has had this business for five years. 

Pura is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which she will use to buy stocks from Natasha and Avon. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Pura hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks from Natasha and Avon.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Georgina forma parte del Banco comunal “Ilusión y una Esperanza” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica al rubro del comercio ambulante, vende ropa usada y accesorios de todo tipo, se dedica a esto desde hace 5 años.
Trabaja de lunes a domingo desde su casa y también en ferias libres. Ella cuenta con mucha clientela
Su mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Santiago por encomienda, ya que ella deposita el dinero y le envían su mercadería (fardos de ropa usada) al terminal de buses en la ciudad de Talca. 
Con el crédito comprará accesorios y juguetes, productos que venderá exclusivamente para la temporada de navidad, además comprará una congeladora para vender helados y bebidas durante la temporada de verano en la feria. 
Sus metas son comprarse una camioneta que le permita trasladar su mercadería, ya que por ahora utiliza un triciclo y a veces paga fletes (alquiler de un medio de transporte), lo que es sacrificado y costoso. 
Georgina vive junto a su marido y sus dos hijos de 9 y 6 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel personal son instalar un local establecido en su casa, ya que esto le permitiría pasar mayor tiempo en su casa, para cuidar a sus hijos. Otro de sus sueños es prosperar en su negocio, para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y costear los estudios superiores de sus hijos. 
Ella está muy agradecida de la ayuda brindada por Fondo esperanza, ya que comenta que sin esta no contaría con su negocio, le ha servido mucho para invertir en mercadería. 
El grupo del banco comunal del cual forma parte es muy unido y responsable, además realizan actividades juntos.
Respecto a las capacitaciones, ha podido asistir a todas, de las cuales ha aprendido sobre contabilidad, especialmente para distribuir sus gastos e ingresos.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
Georgina is a member of the Communal Bank “Ilusión y Una Esperanza” (Illusion and A Hope) which is in the city of Talca. She is a traveling merchant who sells used clothing and all types of accessories. Georgina has been in this business for five years.

She works Monday through Sunday from home but also at the open fairs. Georgina has many customers. Her merchandise is purchased in the city of Santiago and then shipped. She deposits the money and the merchandise (bundles of used clothing) is shipped to the bus terminal in the city of Talca.

With this loan she will buy accessories and toys, products that she will sell exclusively for the Christmas season. In addition, she will buy a cooler so that she can sell ice cream treats and beverages during the summer at the fair. Her goals include buying a truck so that she can transport her merchandise. She currently uses a tricycle, but sometimes she will rent a vehicle, which requires sacrifice and cost.

Georgina lives with her husband and two children, age 9 and 6. Her dreams on a personal level include establishing a store in her house, which would allow her to spend more time at home to look after her children. Another goal is to prosper her business so that she can provide a better quality of life for her family and pay for her children’s higher education.

Georgina is very grateful for the support Fondo Esperanza has provided. She says that she would not have a business without it because the assistance she received enabled her to invest in merchandise. Her Communal Bank group is very close and responsible. In addition, they participate in activities together. With regard to the training, Georgina attends all of the classes and has learned accounting, especially the distribution of her expenses and income.

Talca is in the region of Maule and is located in the central part of the country. It is the administrative, economic, and cultural center of the region and is one of the most important cities in the Chilean Central Valley. One curious reference to Talca that is used in Chile is the phrase, “Talca, Paris, and London”. Some say that the phrase was originally attributed to an Englishman who said, “Talca feels like London” because of the abundant fog that frequently covers the city during winter, just like in the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to buy accessories and toys to sell for the Christmas season and a cooler for selling ice cream treats and beverages at the fairs.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana sells Fante kenkey (fermented corn dough wrapped in plantain or banana leaves) at Enyinase.

She is divorced and has five children. As a single parent, she feeds, clothes, and educates her children with the income she makes from her sales.  

She will use her loan to buy bags of maize for the preparation of the kenkey. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and provide a meaningful education for her children.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize for the preparation of the kenkey.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en: Cecelia is a 48-year-old married woman with 10 children. Her children are between the ages of 5 and 30 years old. Cecelia’s husband works as a farmer. Cecelia is also a farmer. She and her husband till their land in Trinidad, Bohol together. Cecelia’s husband mainly manages their rice farm. Cecelia, on the other hand, does her best to help maintain their farm and run their sari-sari store business. Cecelia works hard to keep her family healthy and her children in school. Cecelia has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds and school supplies. Cecelia hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds and school supplies

loans.name: Libia Mercedes

texts.es: Libia es una mujer de 23 años de edad y tiene muchas aspiraciones en los próximos años de prosperar su comercio su historia empezó cuando trabaja en el almacén y decidió comprar un catalogo y uniforme a vender, su trabajo lo hace con su hermana de 9 AM hasta la 5 PM, si tiene dificultades son la delincuencia, no está casada, no tiene hijos, su sueño más importante es tener un local propio. Por  eso quiere el préstamo para la comprar perfumes, cremas, desodorantes, sabanas etc.
texts.en: Libia is a 23 year-old woman and she has many aspirations for the coming years to prosper in her sales. Her story starts when she was working in a store and decided to buy a catalog and a uniform for selling. She does her work with her sister, from 9AM until 5PM. If she has any difficulties, it is crime. She is not married. She doesn’t have children. Her most important dream is to have her own store. She wants the loan to buy perfumes, creams, deodorants, sheets, etc.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, deodorants, and sheets

loans.name: Albena

texts.en:
Albena T. is 29 years old. She is single and still lives in her parents’ apartment.

Albena is trained digital specialist. After graduation she has worked as a technical assistant in the Vratza brunch of Bulgarian Telecommunication Company. Three years later she quits starting her own business.

Albena T. runs a communication center in Vratza in which she supplies internet, internet phone calls services, copying and printing services and so on.

The $ 1100 loan she will use to buy a new color copying machine for her communication center.

loans.use: To buy a new color copying machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her salon business and buy modern equipment

loans.name: Kan

texts.en:
Khan C. is a farmer who lives with her husband and 10 children in Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. She works almost day and night in her farm growing crops, feeding domestic animals such as pigs, chickens, and ducks. Her husband is a village chief who is responsible for the finances in the household and typically makes around 10/day in revenue. Five of her children have their own families and live separately, yet the others are students and still living at home. Khan C., who is 45 years old, hopes to use the loan to purchase more extra animal's food to supplement her farm. 
In the future, Mrs. C. hopes to own another piece of land to extend her business and she would like to purchase more animals in order to make additional income. Her greatest hope is  to earn enough money to send her children to the local university.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed for her farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase her stock and hire a guard

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia O. is 55 years old, married, and has nine children. She hails from Benin City and operates a business center where she types and photocopies documents. She has had her micro-business since 2003.

Patricia needs a loan of US$ 800 to enable her to buy an additional photocopying machine and a computer in order to serve her customers better.

loans.use: To buy an additional photocopying machine and a computer

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
At 57 years of age, Widow Ablavi K. has to struggle to support herself and her children. After the death of her husband in Accra, Ghana, she was obliged to come back to live in Togo near her extended family since she had no one to help her. To deal with the situation, she began a little business selling foodstuffs. Her very limited financial resources do not allow her to satisfy all her customers' needs, however, and she risks losing her clientele if she is not able to remedy this situation. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of US$ 700. This will allow her to expand her inventory of foodstuffs and retain her customers. She is counting on your aid in ameliorating her little business and thus her standard of living.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Agée de 57 ans, Veuve Ablavi K. se bat pour subvenir à ses besoins et celui de ses enfants. Après la mort de son mari à Accra au Ghana, elle a été obligée de revenir vivre au Togo auprès de sa famille car elle n’a personne pour l’aider. Pour sortir de cette situation elle a commencé un petit commerce de denrées alimentaires. Ses moyens si maigres ne lui permet d'être à la hauteur de sa clientèle et risque de les perdre s'il ne fait rien. Pour remédier à cela, elle sollicite un crédit de $700. Ceci lui permettra de s'approvisionner en denrées et mieux satisfaire les clients. Elle compte sur votre financement pour améliorer son commerce et son niveau de vie.

loans.use:
purchasing foodstuffs for resale

Approvisionnement en denrées alimentaires

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James N. is a radiator repairer at Moree Junction near Cape Coast. He repairs radiators and fans and sells water holes for all kinds of cars. He also has his own shop.
