He is a well-known radiator repairer. He is married with four children ages 18, 14, 10 and 8 respectively. His wife is a trader who sells kenkey, a typical Ghanaian food. James is a hardworking man. In addition to the repairs, he also sells clips and car bearings.

One major challenge that James faces is that he has run out of stock of radiators, fans, and waterholes because his suppliers now demand advance payment before supply is made to him.

James is therefore asking for a loan of US $800 to enable him to fill his store with more radiators, fans for all kinds of cars, waterholes, clips and bearings. He intends to pay the loan back within seven months.

loans.use: To fill his store with more radiators, fans for all kinds of cars, waterholes, clips and bearings.

loans.name: Saedet

texts.en: Saedet is 44-year-old woman who sells wedding dresses and wedding accessories in her own store located in the Sabirabad region. She has seven years of experience in this field. Her store is always full of customers and she Is not just a trader but a master of style. As spring is high season for wedding parties,  she would like to purchase more dresses because she knows that it will be the perfect time to increase her income. She has already saved some earnings and she needs an additional 1200 USD to achieve her goals.

loans.use: Purchasing more wedding dresses for her shop

loans.name: María De La Luz

texts.es:
María de la Luz started to sell cosmetics by catalogue 10 years ago in order to help her husband raise their 4 children. Her three eldest children are married, so she only has to support her youngest, who is a student. Nevertheless, she recently became a widow, which is why María continues with her business now that she has bills to pay and a child to raise on her own. María does not want to be a burden on her other children, and while they do help her out a bit, they cannot pay for everything she needs.

However because María has been in the business for many years, she has accumulated an extensive list of customers. Her only problem is that she has received many orders that she cannot fill due to lack of funds. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of $700.00 USD, which she is willing to repay within 6 months. She will be able to purchase the merchandise that her customers are requesting with this loan. With your support, María can help her son get ahead in life.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 10 años que María de la Luz comenzó a vender cosméticos por catálogo, para ayudarle a su esposo a pagar los gastos de sus 4 hijos. Actualmente tres de ellos (los mayores) ya están casados y ella mantiene sólo al más pequeño quien está estudiando. Sin embargo hace poco que enviudó, y es por eso que María sigue con su negocio, puesto que necesita dinero para poder pagarle los gastos a su hijo y los de la casa puesto que María no desea ser una carga para sus hijos, a pesar de que éstos la ayudan poco, no pueden pagarle todo lo que ella necesita.

Sin embargo María por tener muchos años en este negocio ya cuenta con una cartera grande de clientes. Pero el problema que tiene es que ya le han hecho varios pedidos que María no a podido surtir por no tener dinero suficiente, es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $700 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero podrá comprar la mercancía que le están solicitando. Con tu ayuda María podrá sacar adelante a su hijo.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma and her husband have always sought a way to raise their 4 children and to offer them a good education. Therefore, nearly all their life, they have been selling different articles, and 7 years ago they began to sell fruit wholesale. Norma's husband travels constantly to the countryside of Peru where he is able to obtain a large amount of fruit which he sends to his wife. Their clients are always pleased due to the sweetness and quality of the fruit. The demand of this fruit has been affected by innumerable reasons and their profits have diminished considerably, nevertheless they do not lose hope that their sales will increase with the help of capital to their business.

Translated from Spanish by Jenny Dean, Kiva Volunteer.

Norma y su esposo siempre han buscado la manera de sostener a sus 4 hijos y brindarles una buena educación, por esa razón es que casi toda su vida han estado dedicados al comercio de diferentes artículos, y hace 7 años a la comercialización de frutas al por mayor. Su esposo viaje constantemente a la selva de su país para enviar desde este lugar gran cantidad de frutas hasta el lugar en el que aguarda su esposa, siempre conquistando a sus clientes con la dulzura de los frutos que oferta en su espacio de ventas. La demanda de estos productos se han visto afectados por innumerables razones y sus ganancias han disminuido considerablemente, sin embargo no pierden las esperanzas de incrementar sus ventas con la ayuda de una inyección de capital a su labor.

loans.use: To Increase Capital to Offer a Better Quality and Variety of Fruit

loans.name: Thi Hoa's Group

texts.vi:
Mrs. Hoa, 45 years old, has 3 children that are going T. school. Her family does a variety of activities such as: working on the rice field, breeding pigs, selling food in the market, etc. T. earn money. Her husband is a hired driver. She wants T. borrow money T. buy ingredients for her food shop in the market. She hopes that her food shop menu will be more various so that she can earn more profit from it. Consequently, she will be abL. T. send her children T. good school. Other members in her group also want T. borrow 125 USD in 25 weeks. They are: Mrs. D. Thi Thu, 46 years old, borrows money T. sell ceremonial decorations in the market; Mrs. L. Thi Thuy, 43 years old, borrows money for her business in the market; Mrs. T. Thi Nu, 37 years old va Mrs. N. Thi Lan, 32 years old, borrow money T. buy more fertilizer; and Mrs. N. Thi Hang, 34 years old, borrows money T. sell candles in the market.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Hòa, 45 tuổi, có ba con đang đi học. Gia đình chị có khá nhiều hoạt động như làm ruộng, nuôi lợn, bán hàng ăn ở chợ... Chồng chị là lái xe thuê. Chị vay vốn để thêm tiền mua nguyên liệu bán hàng ăn. Chị hy vọng vốn vay sẽ giúp cửa hàng ăn của chị phong phú đa dạng hơn từ đó đem lại lợi nhuận cao cho gia đình để con chị được học hành tốt hơn. Các thành viên khác trong nhóm chị cũng đều vay 2006000 đồng trong 25 tuần, gồm: Chị Đào Thị Thư, 46 tuổi, vay vốn để đi chợ bán đồ lễ cúng. Chị Lê Thị Thúy, 43 tuổi, vay để đi chợ. Chị Tô Thị Nụ, 37 tuổi và Chị Nguyễn Thị Lân, 32 tuổi vay vốn để mua phân đạm... Chị Nguyễn Thị Hằng, 34 tuổi, vay vốn để đi chợ bán các loại nến.

loans.use: buy ingredients for food shop, fertilizer, sell ceremonial decorations, candles in the market

loans.name: Maimuna

texts.en:
Maimuna is a married woman with 1 child, age 11. She and her husband also take care of 2 other children, ages 15 and 12. Mainuna has been a clothes seller since 2004. Everyday, she works from 9am to 6pm and can earn a monthly profit of about $400 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
The Mujeres Trabajadoras Group started back in March of 2007. Mrs. Maria G. heard about The Entrepreneurial Women Committee program through another person who was already a member of one of the committees. Maria was interested on the program because most of her neighbors are dedicated to recycling products already and she wanted to organize a group so they can work all together and be able to get loans and credits that will enable them to grow their businesses.

They all value the loan that they will be getting through Fundacion Paraguaya because it will give them the great possibility of counting with a good capital. The members are dedicated to different activities like: recycling, clothing sales, merchandise, coal, and foods.

The Mujeres Solidarias Group consists of 15 members. They work on different activities to collect funds for the group. They also participate in weekly meetings, and make their payments on time. They all recognize their individual responsibility within the Committee in order to strengthen the bond between them. The loan that they are applying for is for approximately 1.200.000 guaranies (Paraguayan currency) for each one. They are in the fifth cycle of the program with "zero" days behind on payments. Something that is remarkable and it shows that is a responsible and trusting group of working women.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

El inicio del Grupo denominado Mujeres Trabajadoras fue en el mes de marzo del 2.007. La Sra. María Gómez se enteró del programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras por intermedio de otra persona ya integrante de un Comité, la Sra. María se interesó por el programa ya que la mayoría de todas sus vecinas se dedican al reciclaje y estaba deseosa de organizar un grupo para trabajar de forma solidaria y retirar créditos que les permitiera ir creciendo en sus negocios.

Todas valoran el préstamo que obtienen de la Fundación Paraguaya ya que le da la gran posibilidad de contar con un buen capital de trabajo. Las integrantes se dedican a distintas actividades como: reciclaje, venta de ropas, mercería, carbón y comidas.

El Grupo Mujeres Solidarias está conformado por 15 integrantes, las mismas realizan distintas actividades para la recaudación de fondos para el grupo, participan de las reuniones todas las semanas y realizan sus pagos puntualmente, las mismas reconocen la importancia que tiene la responsabilidad individual dentro del Comité para fortalecer la unión entre ellas. El de crédito solicitado por estas señoras es 1.200.000 guaraníes cada una. Ellas se encuentran en el quinto ciclo del programa con “cero” días de atraso, algo muy resaltante y que demuestra que son un grupo de mujeres confiables.

`

loans.use: Buying clothes, merchandise, articles for recycling, coal, provisions like: sugar, flour, milk, eggs, meat, soft drinks, other merchandise like: fabrics, buttons, hair ties, etc.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. Le Thi P., 49 years old, joined the TYM Fund since 2006. She has 3 children, one of whom is working and the other 2 are still going to school. Before, her family depended mainly on several small rice fields; therefore, they met a lot of economic difficulties. After joining the Fund and being lent to some money, she had a starting fund to do business on waste materials. This activity requires more work and effort but it brings her more profit. Her husband and son also work and earn 150 USD/month. Since her business goes well and together with the contribution of her husband and son, she is able to repay regularly. Her family economy improves. This time, she wants to borrow 375 USD to breed pigs. Every year, she sells 400 kg pigs. Her average income is 250 USD/month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Duy Hua, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Lê Thị Phú 49 tuổi, tham gia vào Quỹ Tình Thương năm 2006, chị có 3 con, 1con đã đi làm, 2 con vẫn đang đi học, mấy năm về trước gia đình chị chủ yếu trông vào mấy sào ruộng do vậy kinh tế gia đình khó khăn. Tham gia vào Quỹ vay vốn khi có đồng vốn chị đã mạnh dạn sử dụng vốn vay vào việc đi chợ cân phế liệu tuy công việc vất vả nhưng thu nhập cao hơn so với trước, chồng và con chị đi làm thuê hàng tháng thu nhập bình quân 2.500.000đ, chị đi chợ đều đặn cùng với sự cố găng đi làm của chồng và con chị nên việc hoàn trả vốn vay của gia đình chị không khó khăn, kinh tế gia đình chị đã khá hơn rất nhiều các vòng vốn tiếp theo gia đình chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn, hàng năm gia đình chị xuất bình quân 4 tạ lợn.Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 6.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Thu nhập bình quân. 4.000.000đ/ tháng.

loans.use: Pigs

loans.name: Zuhura's Wastara Group

texts.en:
Zuhura is a married woman with six children between 4 and 24. She began selling bites in 2008. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Zuhura now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who also have businesses selling charcoal, bites, clothes, and porridge.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Rohadiah

texts.id: Usaha Rohadiah (53) sebagai penjual barang bekas adalah dengan membeli barang bekas dari pemulung lalu kemudian dijual kembali ke pengumpul dengan harga yang lebih tinggi. Usaha ini tentu saja membutuhkan modal tunai, dan dia sangat berterimakasih sudah diberi bantuan pinjaman modal untuk usahanya. Modal usaha yang dia terima sudah dipakai untuk usahanya ini dan memberikan keuntungan yang cukup besar, oleh karena itu dia bisa melunasi pinjamannya lebih cepat dari waktu seharusnya. Saat ini dia sudah melunasi pinjamannya yang pertama dan ingin meminjam lagi dalam jumlah yang lebih besar dari sebelumnya. Dengan semakin banyaknya modal yang dia miliki, dia berharap pemasukan dari usahanya bisa lebih besar. Keuntungan tersebut ingin dia sisihkan untuk tabungan pendidikan anaknya nanti. Anaknya saat ini masih berusia 12 tahun, dari suaminya Sunarto yang berprofesi sebagai pemulung.
texts.en:
Rohadiah works as a used junk seller. She buys used goods from collectors then sold to wholesaler at higher price. This business is very cash intensive. She is very grateful for previous loan that she used to expand her business and brought her more profit. She paid back her previous loan earlier than promised and now asking for a bigger loan. With increased funding, she hopes to expand her business. She plans to use the business profit to pay for her child's tuition. Rohadiah is 53 year old and married to Sunarto, who works as a junk collector. Her child is 12 year old.

Translated from Indonesian by Kresna Hartandi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Menambah Modal Usaha

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is 23 years old. She is married with 1 child 5 years old. She has been a movies, tapes, and DVD seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 9am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

Sakina is now looking for a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es: Herminio tiene 35 años, en la actualidad el vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos pequeños.  Es un humilde agricultor, que se desempeña desde su niñez en las tareas del campo, ahora  trabaja en la venta y compra de animales al por mayor, de los cuales, consigue lo necesario para solventar a su familia, para ello, con sus propias manos ha construido su establo, para poner ahí a sus animales, y luego de varios meses de alimentación balanceada los vende en las ferias ganaderas, donde va con toda su familia. También se dedica al cultivo de maíz y papa, en pequeñas cantidades, pero si tiene mayores extensiones de alfalfa con la que alimentar a sus animales.  Herminio trabaja por la responsabilidad de ser sustentador de su familia, esa es su razón de ser. Solicita este préstamo, con el que podrá preparar sus tierras de cultivo, con abono y fertilizantes, y también sembrar alfalfa. En un futuro desea tener un establo más espacioso  y mejorar la calidad de sus animales.
texts.en:
Herminio is 35 years old. Currently he lives with his wife and their two small children. He is a humble farmer, who has worked on the tasks of the farm since he was a child. Now he works selling and buying animals for a profit, which has given him what he needs to meet the expenses of his family. For this, with his own hands he built a stable in order to keep his animals inside. Later, over several months of careful feeding he sells them in the markets, where he goes with his entire family. He also works growing corn and potatoes in small quantities, but he has more land in alfalfa with which he feeds his animals. Herminio works to meet the responsibility of supporting his family; this is his reason to be. He asks for this loan, with which he would be able to prepare his lands for farming with fertilizer, and to grow alfalfa. In the future he would like to have a larger stable and to improve the quality of his animals.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his fields

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Medical Equipment, Bed Linens, Sterilizer, and Water Pipes

loans.name: Sorn

texts.en: Sorn R., 55, is married and lives with her husband and four children in the Prey Veng province. She works as a farmer together with her husband growing rice and beans, and they typically make US$3 every day. They are also supported by one child who works in a garment factory. The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year, and inflation has forced food prices to skyrocket. These factors have caused a difficult economic year for many Cambodians. In light of these difficulties, Sorn R. is asking CREDIT for a loan of US$1200 to purchase fertilizer, rice seeds, and gas. She sees this loan as a way to increase her income and is confident that the business venture will be successful. (Sorn R. and her husband were not available for the picture, so her daughter is pictured instead.)

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, rice seeds, and gas.

loans.name: Roen's Group

texts.en: This is a small group loan that consists of three members requesting a loan to Kiva. Mrs. V., 33, is a grocery seller in the Numkreab Village in the Battambang Province. She has been selling since 2004 and can currently earn around $2.50 per day, while her husband is a teacher. She has five children, all of whom are small teenagers. She sells a variety of products such as food ingredients, perfumes, and cakes, etc. Her business is going well because she has good communication, selling skills, and has many regular clients. V. would like to ask for a loan to purchase more grocery inventory. This is the second loan for her; the first one was undertaken individually. The other two members are: Mrs. M., 51, who sells porridge and needs a loan to buy more ingredients and Mrs. S., who is a grocery seller and needs a loan to buy groceries for her expanding business. They all live in the Battambang Province.

loans.use: To purchase grocery inventory

loans.name: Julissa

texts.es:
Julissa es madre y también padre de dos pequeños niños. A los pocos años de tener a su primer hijo se separo con el padre de ese y hace unos pocos años falleció lamentablemente el padre del hijo menor. Situación que la ha llevado a trabajar en lo que ha podido para poder mantener a sus hijos.

Aunque su mama la apoya brindándole alimento y un techo donde vivir, ella debe velar por la educación de sus hijos. 

Empezó vendiendo golosinas en la puerta de su casa, pero poco a poco, gracias a su empeño, fue creciendo en sus ventas y hoy en día no solo se dedica a vender golosinas, sino también accesorios de bisutería. Mas adelante quisiera construir un local para implementar una tienda.
texts.en:
Julissa is both mother and father to two small children. A few years ago after having her first son, she separated from his father. Several years ago the father of her youngest son sadly passed away. This is a situation that has brought her to work in what she can to be able to support her sons. Although her mom helps her by offering them food and a roof under which to sleep, she needs to look out for the education of her sons. She started selling sweets at the entrance of her house, but little by little, thanks to her hard work, her sales grew. Now she not only sells sweets but also accessories. In the future, she would like to construct a location to start a store.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Shafi

texts.en:
Shafi is 50 years old. He is a married man with four children. Shafi’s main source of income is in the transportation sector. Shafi was a farmer and eventually bought a car to transport vegetables and fruits to the neighboring cities and towns. Through this business Shafi supports his wife and four children.

The loan he is requesting will be used to repair the engine of his car and buy new tires. This will allow him to better provide for his family. He deeply appreciates the trust and support you are giving him. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Repair a car engine purchase new tires

loans.name: Yay

texts.en:
Mr. B. uses a trailer-cart to transport the charcoal he sells. He has been selling charcoal for more than nine years, earning income of about $3.66 each day. Mr. B. is married and the father of five teenage children who attend school. His wife, SiLeun, is 43 years old and a local vegetable planter.

Mr. B.'s business currently is doing well, and he has gained more income. Recently, he has needed capital for his business operation, so he is seeking a loan to buy additional charcoal to sell. Mr. B. is a responsible man to his family, and has supplied all they need. He is seeking to ensure that his children get the best education possible for the future. The family lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Ghanem

texts.en:
Ghanem is a 50 year old man who lives in Aley, Mount Lebanon with his wife and their five children. Ghanem has owned a clothing shop for three years. He also sells shoes. Ghanem requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Ghanem has requested a loan.

Ghanem is special in his work because he knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When Ghanem first started his business, he faced the competition. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop.

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru: Чураев Шавкат- мужчина 32 лет. У него есть жена и трое детей. Шавкат начaл работать  самостоятельно с 18 лет. Он каждый год на заработки ездил в Россию из за финансового кризиса в этом году он не поехал. Он узнал о нашей программе кредитования у соседей и решил попробовать,  он очень доволен нашими условиями. Шавкату помогает отец и жена. Свой скот Шавкат реализует у мясников. Также жена продает молоко соседям. Шавкат очень признателен нашей организации хочет в дальнейшем развиваться.
texts.en:
Shavkat J. is a 32 year old man. He has a wife and three children. Shavkat started to work independently when he was 18 years old. He traveled every year to earn money in Russia, because of the financial crisis this year he did not go. He found out about our credit program from neighbors and decided to try it, he is very happy with our terms. Shavkat’s father and wife help him. Shavkat sells his livestock to butchers. Also his wife sells milk to neighbors. Shavkat is very grateful to our organization and would like to develop further.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Feeding livestock

loans.name: Dang Thi

texts.en:
H. Dang Thi is thirty-four year old and lives in the town of Hung Nguyen.  She is married and has three school-age children.  To make a living, H. owns and operates a sewing business. The main source of income from the business comes from making and selling clothes to local businesses and community members.  H. has been engaged in this business for over ten years and earns approximately $190 a month from these activities.


In 2005, H. joined the Kiva field partner, TYM Fund, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by having the ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid previous loans from TYM Fund.  These loans were used to invest in expanding her business.  H. is now requesting a new loan that will be used to purchase material and supplies to make more clothing to sell.  This loan will be her fifth loan from TYM Fund.  H. plans to use the additional revenue that is generated as a result of the loan to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy material and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Мамлакат хочет получив кредит закупить партию женских летних платьев и костюмов. Она заметно смогла при помощи кредитов увеличить свой товарооборот и доход.При мониторинге она была в отъезде за товаром в Бишкек.На месте торговли её дочь.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. Mamlakat would like to take out a loan to purchase a lot of women's summer dresses and suits. With the assistance of previous loans, she has been able to increase her trade turnover and increase her income. During our visit, she was on a trip to the capital, Bishkek, to purchase more products, and her daughter was minding the store.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of men's and women's clothing

loans.name: Saren

texts.en:
Mrs. Saren S., age 39, and her husband, Mr. Kunthea Toun, 41, live along National Road Number One, about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1993 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. 

Mrs. Saren S. has been selling fish for 16 years. She buys some of the fish from her villagers and her husband is also a fisherman. She sells the fish Korky market. Mr. Kunthea Toun has been a fisherman for 16 years; he catches fish from the lake nearby his house.

The couple hopes to supplement their income by growing vegetables, but they lack the capital. Therefore, Saren is requesting her first loan of $500 to purchase bamboo and nets to build a shelter for her vegetables.

loans.use: To towards growing vegetables.

loans.name: Christy

texts.en: Christy E. is 58 years old and married with four children. She sells sarongs of various colors. She is asking for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell.  She thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase sarongs

loans.name: Perfecta

texts.en:
Perfecta B. owns and operates a sari-sari, or general store, selling daily use products such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste, etc. She is 63 years old, married and has six adult children. She is from the village of Cabolanonan, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Perfecta has been in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Perfecta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Perfecta has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 5,905 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding a sari-sari store

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina grinds things like pepper, beans, corn and tomatoes in the market. She is 40 years old and married with four children. She has been in this business since 2002. She hopes for a loan 150,000 nairas to purchase a grinder. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a grinder

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a member of the Amani borrower group in Kinyanambo, Iringa. She is 21 year old woman, she is married and a mother of 1 child. Her child is 4 years old.

Lucy has owned a salon business for 2 years, she works 12 hours a day and she earns a monthly profit approximately 120,000 Tanzanian shillings.

This is Lucy`s first loan from BRAC_Tanzania, she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities for salon.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Lucy hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities for salon

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria B. is from the village of Libertad Alto,Sinacaban,Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Victoria is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Victoria owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising goats for sale. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over 16 years and earns approximately 4,800.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Victoria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victoria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to build shelter for the borrower's livestock. Victoria is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Victoria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina es una mujer de 43 años que tiene 2 hijos: Andrei de 23 y Luis Ángel de 4 años. También vive con su pareja de toda la vida, Ángel de 42 años, quien es obrero de construcción.
Desde hace 3 años ella tiene una pequeña librería en su casa. Se decidió por este negocio al notar que no había alguna librería cerca de su casa, por lo cual considera su negocio muy rentable, ya que no tiene competencia cercana, además puede vender otros productos en el mismo espacio. A Dina le gusta su trabajo porque es independiente y puede realizarlo desde la comodidad de su hogar y puede dedicarles tiempo a sus hijos, los cuales necesitan mucho de ella. 

Para el futuro quiere tener una tienda más surtida y grande, en la cual pueda ofrecer variados productos, ya que está pensado habilitar un espacio para poder vender comestibles y artículos de tocador, como jabones, pasta dental;  además de detergentes, etc. esperando expandir así su negocio y abastecer las necesidades de toda su clientela. 

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP, a ella le gusta conformar su banco comunal, pues siente seguridad y responsabilidad en el grupo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más útiles de escritorio para su librería, además de otros productos para complementar su negocio así agrandar su tienda.
texts.en:
Dina is a 43 year old woman with 2 sons, Andrei (age 23) and Luis Ángel (age 4). She lives with her partner Ángel, who is 42 years old and a construction worker.

For three years, Dina has managed a small bookstore out of her home. She says she started this business because there was no other bookstore nearby and thought it would be very profitable since she would not have any competition. Dina also sells other products from the same retail space. She enjoys her work because it allows her to be independent. In addition, she can work out of the comfort of her own home and spend time with her children who still need her.

In the future, Dina wants to have a larger store that is stocked with various products to offer. She intends to have more space so that she can sell groceries and toiletries such as soaps and toothpastes, as well as detergents and other items. By expanding her business, Dina hopes she can meet the needs of her customers.

This is her second loan with MFP. Dina enjoys being part of her Communal Bank because she thinks it is a trustworthy and responsible group. With the money she is requesting, she will purchase stationery for her bookstore and other products to complement and expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to expand her inventory

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Ce jeune homme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de friperie. Son commerce se situe dans le quartier de Nukafu à Lomé, à côté d’une station d’essence. Il a débuté cette activité depuis 2005 et grâce à cette revente, il arrive à subvenir à ses besoins. Il vend des chemises, des pantalons Jeans à des prix défiant toute concurrence. Il a de bonnes relations avec ses fournisseurs, qui lui fournissent les meilleures marchandises à l’ouverture de nouvelles balles. Il sollicite en ce moment un crédit de WAGES pour commander une balle de T-shirt, une balle de pantalon Jean et une balle de chemise. Cet homme n’est pas marié et n’a aucun enfant à sa charge.
texts.en:
This young man works at selling used clothing to earn a living. His business is situated in the Nukafa district of Lomé, next to a gas station. He began the business in 2005 and, thanks to reselling these used clothing, he manages to support himself. He sells shirts and Jeans at prices which can't be outdone. He has good relations with his suppliers, who furnish him the best merchandise when they open up new bales. He is presently requesting a loan from WAGES to order a bale of T-shirts, a bale of Jeans, and a bale of shirts. This gentleman is not married and is not responsible for any children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 3 bales of used clothing: T-shirts, Jeans, and shirts

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida A. is now 51 years old and already a widow. Her husband met with an accident and unfortunately died. At that time their child was only two years old.

Despite of what happened, Leonida was not discouraged because she thought of their child’s future, and taught their child. Through her patience and sacrifices, her daughter graduated with a degree of Bachelor of Science in Elementary Education. She presently teaches at Baresbes Elementary school.

For the sake of their future, Leonida continues her business to help her daughter in earning income for their survival and for their future.

Leonida engages in buying and selling of charcoal. She also plants some vegetables in the garden which she sells at Solano Public Market. She plans to buy more charcoal and plant more vegetables in their garden for her to earn more income.

In this regard she is requesting 9000 PHP from KIVA lenders for additional capital.

loans.use: Additional capital for selling vegetables and charcoal.

loans.name: Ivy Ma.

texts.en:
A single mother of one child in the person of Ivy Ma. S. is our featured entrepreneur. She is 39 years old and a resident of Barangay III, Tangub City. With God’s help she was able to support her child, being the sole breadwinner in the family. Now her son is working in Dubai.

Even if she receives monthly support, Ivy Ma. still has the love of operating a business – a sari-sari (variety) store. Currently she is earning an average net income of not less than P6,000 from her stall located at Tangub City IBJT (Integrated Bus and Jeepney Terminal) or at Agora.

Ivy Ma. joined Paglaum MPC a year ago and is so thankful. Indeed, it’s a great honor for her being a member of the most outstanding cooperative in Northern Mindanao, and the awarded coop for being “Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines” during the search for the COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006.

For her 2nd loan, she is given the privilege of obtaining P10,000 to add to her capital for her existing sari-sari store business. The future income from this loan will be used for her daily expenditures and part saved for future use.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Hanim

texts.en:
Hanim A. is currently in the business of selling beans, tomatoes, and rice. She is requesting a loan to purchase dried and fresh fish to sell. Hanim is 32 years old and is married with a husband who is a teacher. She has 4 children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Purchase dried and fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Ulziijargal

texts.en: Ulziijargal is 50 years old and lives with her husband and four children in the Zavkhan province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her children, aged 18, 20, and 25, attend a university. Ulziijargal owns a dairy product retail business that she operates at the local market in her town. She began her business in 2007 and, since then, she has stabilized her business and has earned many loyal customers. The winter months are important for dairy retailers, as it is the time when the price of milk goes up. Ulziijargal is requesting a loan for 500,000 tugrugs (~350 USD) in order to purchase a large amount of dairy products from the countryside. She can prepare for the price increase by purchasing the products now, and she will earn more profit.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of dairy products.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is 53 years old, married and the mother of four children, all of whom have completed school and are working. Abena lives with her husband in a community in the central region of Ghana. She is a food vendor who prepares and serves kenkey in her neighborhood. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked, and eaten with hot pepper and fried fish. Abena has many customers since many Ghanaian enjoy kenkey for breakfast, lunch and supper. She has been selling kenkey for twenty five years now. In addition, she also sells raw food such as bags of maize at the market square. Abena was able to provide for her children from the kenkey business. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She would be glad for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials (maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen sells yams in Sapele. She is a friendly and hard-working woman. She travels far to the northern part of Nigeria to purchase yams to sell in Sapele. She loves this business because it gives her joy when her customers come to purchase yams. She is hoping for the loan amount of NGN 50,000 to purchase more yams to sell. She hopes to grow her business. 

Helen is 45 years old and married to a welder and they are blessed with 5 children. Her children are excelling in school. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 30 years old and married with one child.  He has been running a photography, video coverage and card production business for seven years.  He also runs a transport business where he offers rides with his motorcycle.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has become financially empowered and has learned customer care skills.  He hopes to open a national service media and be the director of that business in the future. He has requested a loan of KES. 80,000 to buy a motorcycle for his business.  He describes himself as a hardworking, patient, aggressive and ambitious man.

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Faleupolu

texts.en:
Faleupolu  S. is 42 and married with 10 children.  She owns a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community.  Faleupolu  has 5 years of experience in this business.  Faleupolu  needs a loan of WST $1250 to purchase new items to expand product offering.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Faleupolu  joined SPBD.This is her 3rd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Faleupolu 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Faleupolu  S. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.6 out of 3
Level of Education:                              1.5 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.7 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2.3 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El señor Francisco es casado y tiene 3 hijos,  es taxista desde hace 30 años, ha trabajado como chofer de flota y hace el servicio de taxis de Santa Cruz a Paurito, tambien trabaja con las colonias de menonitas de las brechas llevando medicamentos de los cuales gana porcentajes. en las temporadas de siembra ayuda a su cuñado sembrando sandia, yuca, los cuales le genera ingresos adicionales que ayudan al mantenimiento del hogar. Junto con su esposa se encargan de la educacion y alimentacion de tres de sus hijos, uno de sus hijos tambien ayuda a sus padres ya que trabaja medio dia en la venta de CD`s en el mercado La Ramada. Con el dinero del credito com prara repuestos para su vehiculo y para el mantenimiento del mismo ya que esta teniendo algunas fallas, el  señor Francisco es un hombre trabajador que dia a dia se esfuerza para darles lo necesario a su familia y asi poder mejorar su calidad de vida, uno de sus deseos es de comprar una casa para ir a vivir con toda su familia ya que vive en alquiler y es mucho dinero perdido ya que los meses pasan rapidos. Esta muy agracecido con emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco is married and has three children. He has been a taxi driver for 30 years and currently works as part of a fleet of vehicles that provides taxi services between Santa Cruz and Paurito. Francisco also works for the Mennonite colonies by delivering medicines, of which he earns a percentage. During the planting season, he helps his brother-in-law grow watermelons and cassava to earn additional income to maintain his household. His wife is in charge of feeding and acquiring an education for their three children. One child helps out by working half-days at the Ramada Market selling CDs.

The funds he requested will be used to buy spare parts for his vehicle and pay for maintenance since it is currently experiencing a few problems. Sr. Francisco is a hardworking gentleman who strives day after day to provide his family everything they need and improve their quality of life. One of his wishes is to buy a house in which his entire family can live because he loses a considerable amount of money paying rent as the months pass by quickly. He is extremely grateful to Emprender and Kiva for demonstrating their confidence in him by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria O. is from the village of Villalin Panaon, Mis. Occ. She is 35 years old. Victoria is married and has 3 school-aged children. Victoria owns & operates a business providing motorcycle transport to local community members. Victoria has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2008, Victoria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business. Victoria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as, additional capital for her business. Victoria is requesting a fourth loan, for 7,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Bonita

texts.en:
Bonita A. is from the village of San Agustin, Sto. Tomas, Pangasinan. She is 43 years old, married and has 3 school-aged children. Bonita owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Bonita has been involved in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month from it. Bonita also has a junk shop which is being managed by her husband.

In 2008, Bonita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bonita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Bonita is requesting a new loan, her 5th, of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn B. is from the town of Banga. She is 23 years old, is married, and has a 3-year-old child.

Jenelyn owns and operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jenelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional piglets and feeds. This loan will be her first from CEVI.

Jenelyn plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets and feeds

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita C.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting banana for sale. She is 56 years old, married and has five grown-up children. She is from the village of Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. Juanita has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Juanita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Juanita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be her sixth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Constant

texts.fr:
Jeune homme de 32 ans, marie avec 3 enfants dont l'age varie entre 3 et 10 ans.Apres son Bac,n'ayant pas des moyens pour faire des etudes universitaires, il ouvre un cafetariat ou il sert des petits dejeuners comme omelettes, pain au beurre avec the au lait, cafe au lait, des spaguetti, et des boissons gazeuses. Comme son cafetariat est situe dans un marche , il a des recettes de 15000 a 30000frs par jour.

Avec ce pret il compte renforcer les produits de premiere necessite de son cafetariat comme 50 kg de sucre,  douzaine de beurre pasteurise et margarine ,des cartons de lait, cartons de spaguetti et des palettes des oeufs et tous produits que l'on consomme regulierement dans son cafetariat.

Pour faire avancer son affaire ,il epargne souvent et fasait des tontines parcequ'il a la vision d'ouvrir un grand cafe  dans peu de temps.

Il veut a la longue construire une maison pour sa famille et ses enfants  mettre dans les meilleures ecoles.
texts.en:
This is a young man, aged 32.  He is married and has three children, ranging in age from 3 to 10.  After his high school diploma but unable to afford university education, he opened a cafeteria, where he serves breakfast, such as omlettes, bread with butter and tea with milk, coffee with milk, spaghetti, and carbonated drinks.  Since his cafeteria is located in a market, he earns 15,000 to 30,000 francs per day. With this loan, he intends to boost his supplies necessary for his cafeteria including 50 kg of sugar, a dozen units of pasteurized butter and margarine, boxes of milk, boxes of spaghetti, trays of eggs, and all the products that are consumed regularly in his cafeteria. To advance his business, he often saves money and participates in tontines because his vision is to open a big café in a short time. Later on, he wants to build a house for him family and to put his children into the best schools.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying butter, milk, cocoa, spaghetti, trays of eggs, and sugar

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Men K., 68, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for Pre-Angkorean Temples. She is a housewife, while her husband is a village chief earning an income of USD 1 per day. Her is child is currently employed at a local garment factory, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses.  K. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a new motorbike for her child to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en: Nathan L. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda.  He is married and has 4 children, who are in school.  For 5 years Nathan has run a business raising cattle and running a butchery. To help expand his business, Nathan is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy feed and other supplies.  Nathan hopes that the loan will allow him to further grow his business.  In the future, Nathan hopes to expand operations and gain more profit for his family.

loans.use: To buy feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Melowgen

texts.en: Melowgen is 44 years old, married, and lives in the province of Antique in the Philippines with her husband and two children. To make a better living, Melowgen sells gasoline and gas from her house. She has been a busy entrepreneur for almost two years. Melowgen would like a loan to purchase gallons of gasoline and gas amounting 10,000 PHP. Melowgen is grateful for the secure access to capital and loans to fund her entrepreneurial dreams. Her long-term goals are to expand her business, support her family financially, and fund the college education of her two children through college. With the support of Kiva lenders and her own entrepreneurial effort, she is focused on building a winning business.

loans.use: To purchase gallons of gasoline and gas.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Materials to develop her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria E. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Tuburan, Brgy Vito, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a fish vending business. Her husband Federico E., who is 55 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living, and also helps with his wife's business activities.  They have 10 children, who are between the ages of 12 and 33. Maria joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 because she wanted something better for her family. With the help of her past 9 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Maria has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8000, uplifting her family's standard of living. This time, for her 10th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19500, which she intends to use to purchase fishing nets for the business so that she can continue to save up for the future needs of her family. Maria E. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase fishing nets.

loans.name: Meylin Cristina .

texts.es:
El clienta Meylin Cristina M. G.. Vive en el municipio santa Rosa Del Peñón departamento de león Zona No. 2 de la iglesia católica 1/2c al norte, Es soltera  trabaja actual mente en MINED santa Rosa del peñón desempeña  el cargo como coordinadora municipal del Alfabetización tiene 3 años de estar laborando en esta institución.
El cliente cuanta con una casa de habitación familiar el cual la quiere mejorar.
El destino del crédito es para la Compra de cemento y sin para techo de su Habitación.  Para el mejoramiento de su vivienda. 
Esto le permitirá vivir en condiciones favorable a su familia.
texts.en:
Meylin Cristina M. Gonzalez lives in the Santa Rosa Del Peñón municipality (1/2 block north of the Catholic Church in zone 2) in the León department.  She is single, and she currently works the Santa Rosa Del Peñón MINED (Ministry of Education).  She is the municipal coordinator for literacy.  She has been working for this institution for three years.  She has her own house, and she wants to improve it.

The loan is to improve her house by purchasing cement and zinc for the roof.  This will allow her family to live under more favorable conditions.

loans.use: To buy cement and zinc

loans.name: Eliseo

texts.en:
Eliseo M. is from the village of Malibangcao Clarin Misamis Occidental. He is 36 years old and married. To make a living, Eliseo owns and operates a transportation services business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Eliseo has been engaged in his business for over one year and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Eliseo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eliseo is requesting a new loan of 26,000 PHP, which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Eliseo from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his  family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherpeople, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Inelda Del Socorro

texts.es:
Inelda R. del municipio de San Juan Nepomuceno, en el departamento de Bolívar, es una mujer casada con 3 hijos en las edades de 18 a 28 años,  que desde hace seis años inició  su microempresa de venta de mercancías variadas,  acompañada de una amiga con quien  logró obtener su primera clientela en un mercado doméstico conformado por en un grupo minoritario de habitantes de su pueblo; pero gradualmente el espíritu emprendedor e  independiente de Inelda, la llevó a pensar en trabajar directamente y acudió hace alrededor de 5 años a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo donde recibió su primer financiamiento y logró independizarse de su amiga. Este es su cuarto financiamiento y con su credikiva estaría preparándose para la temporada de fin de año, que viene con muchas solicitudes de sus clientes con relación a productos que ella vende:   vestidos para niños, para damas y caballeros y ropa interior.  Inelda con sus productos obtiene una utilidad del 28% y esta inyección de capital de trabajo le augura éxito , pues hay dinero circulante en el mercado en esta temporada y sus ventas repuntan pues es una bella época de integración familiar y fiestas para despedir el año. Inelda se muestra muy satisfecha con sus financiamientos en la Fundación, porque ha logrado apoyar la gestión de su hogar, especialmente los estudios de su hija que se prepara como fisioterapeuta, realizar adecuaciones de su vivienda y aumentar sus ventas, las  que mucho han contribuido con el aumento de sus utilidades para generar oportunidades a sus hijos y mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales.
Su sueño es tener un local en su casa, o punto de ventas provistos de vitrinas bien dispuestas y surtidas,  donde los clientes encuentren todo lo que ellos necesitan, así como lograr que su hija termine su carrera y se perfile para ser una profesional exitosa.
texts.en:
Inelda R. from San Juan Nepomuceno, Bolívar department, is a married woman with three children whose ages range from 18 to 28, who six years ago started her micro business selling assorted merchandise with a friend who helped her get her first customers in a domestic market made up of a minority group of townsfolk.  Gradually her enterprising and independent spirit moved her to work directly and five years ago she came to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo where she got her first loan allowing her to become independent from her friend.

This is her fourth loan and she will use the Kiva funds to prepare for the end of year season that is approaching.  She has many pending orders for her type of merchandise from customers: children’s clothes, women’s and men’s clothes and underwear.

Inelda earns a 28% profit and this injection of capital foretells success for her because there is cash circulating in the market this time of year and sales spike because it’s a beautiful time when families come together at parties to say farewell to the year.

Inelda is very satisfied with loans from the Fundación because they have helped her support her household, especially her daughter’s training as a physiotherapist, some house repairs and increases in sales which have contributed to higher profits leading to opportunities for her children and to home improvements.

Her dream is to have store in her home or a sales point with well situated and stocked display cases where customers can find everything they need as well as have her daughter finish her professional training so that she can be poised to become a successful professional.

loans.use: To buy women's, men's and children's clothing and underwear.

loans.name: Houch

texts.en: Houch S., 25 years old, lives in the capital city of Phnom Penh. She earns her profit by working in the garment factory as worker. She has a fixed salary every month. She generates a profit approximately of US$ 3 a day to help support her family’s daily expenses with more stability. Her husband is a sugar cane juice seller in his community. This couple has just married and have only one child so far. Houch S. now lives with her mother. They have some savings in an account, but it is not enough. To solve this problem, she would like to request a loan to add to her savings to purchase a small house for living. Houch S. was not available for the photograph, so her husband is shown in the picture instead.

loans.use: To purchase a small house for living.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan Y. is 38 years old. He is married and has two children. His wife is a housekeeper, and the business of Hasan is the main source of income of his large family. Hasan has been providing transportation services for the last 13 years. Usually, he transports cargo from Dushanbe to Pamir. Hasan dreams that all of his children will be well educated, so he works hard. As a result, the business generates a significant income that allows him to support his large family. In order to provide better service for his clients and earn more, Hasan needs to make major repairs to his lorry. He believes that this will make his business more profitable. With this purpose in mind, he is requesting a loan of 1,500 USD.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for the lorry.

loans.name: Muhammed

texts.en: Muhammad is a forty-six-year-old  married man with five children.  He lives in a semi-permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. He sells clothes, and his ambition is to start a shop and leave the mobile business. He dreams of educating his children such that they can have a bright future.  Muhammed needs the credit to buy clothes to resell during the Christmas season.

loans.use: To buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 23 years old, married and has one child who is six months old. Angelique sells foodstuffs, cooking oil, and soda, which she has been doing for four years. Her husband is a motorcyclist.  

Angelique will use this loan to buy more merchandise to sell.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Angelique plans to build a house. In the future she would like to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs to sell.

loans.name: Delina

texts.es: Delina, de 30 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Mario (40)  y sus cinco hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor  calidad de vida.Se dedica  al  cultivo de plátano y café. Todos los días, muy temprano, empieza con su labor  en sus cultivos, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga de la venta de su cosecha, dependerá mucho de la calidad de sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos, ya lleva cuatro  años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras. Para más adelante, desea cultivar en mayor cantidad, para incrementar su producción.Es  el primer préstamo de Delina con MFP, y manifiesta que el dinero del crédito le ayudara mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidaria con todas, además de responsable.Con los mil soles solicitados, comprará mayor cantidad de  abono y fertilizantes que necesita  para mejorar la productividad de sus cultivos, de esta manera espera salir adelante.
texts.en:
Delina is 30 years old.  She is a very simple and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband Mario (40) and her five children for whom she would like to provide a better quality of life.

Delina grows bananas and coffee.  Very early every morning she starts work on her crops since she knows that the money she obtains for selling her harvest will depend a lot on the quality of her products.  What she most likes about her work is harvesting her crops since that is when she feels that the months of work have borne fruit.  She has been in this business for four years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be spraying her land.  In the future, she would like to grow a larger quantity of crops and increase her production.

This is Delina's first loan with MFP and she says that the loan money will help her a lot in making progress in her work.  She very well liked by the other members of her community bank since she is very supportive of the other members and also responsible.  She will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy a larger quantity of manure and fertilizers that she needs in order to improve the productivity of her crops.  In this way, she hopes to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy manure and insecticides to improve her crops

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph, 28, is a farmer.  He does dairy and horticultural farming so as to earn his daily bread.  He was able to start farming four years ago with the help of Faulu Kenya.   So far, he has managed to employ two people in his business.  He hopes to become financially stable in the future.  He has requested a loan of 60,000 Kes to enlarge his farm.

loans.use: To enlarge his farm

loans.name: Boaz Ouma

texts.en:
Boaz O. is a 24-year-old man from Kisumu, a lakeside city 500 kilometers from Nairobi, the capital of Kenya. He is married to Susan and they have a three-month-old child. He is the sole breadwinner of the family.

Boaz operates a motorcycle transport business (locally known as BodaBoda) in the heart of Kisumu, a business he has been running for the last two years.  He makes a monthly income of Kshs10,000. He recently joined KADET LTD and has applied for a loan of KES 51,000 to buy another motorcycle.  

He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business by buying more motorcycles. He believes that by acquiring more motorcycles, his income will increase and he will be able to provide a source of employment to other young people in his home area. He is therefore looking for Kiva lenders to help him advance this dream.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Mouy

texts.en: Mouy M., 35, is a widow who lives alone and has a job as a grocery seller. She sells her items to the neighbors who live near her house in the village, Siem Reap province. Mouy M. was married for years, but divorced her husband and has no children. In order to earn more profit, Mouy M. is requesting a loan to purchase the large quantity of grocery goods for selling.

loans.use: To purchase the large quantity of grocery goods for selling

loans.name: Afrodis

texts.en:
Afrodis is 32 years old and has two children, aged 1 and 4. The first child has enrolled in nursery school. 

Afrodis has been in business for eight years as a food seller. He has been saving money to buy her own home.

He is requesting a loan to buy more food and he intends to use the profits gained from this loan to buy the house and some domestic animals.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of potatoes, beans, rice and more

loans.name: Julian

texts.es: Julián, de 30 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Mery de 29 años y sus 2 queridos hijos y lo que más desea es sobresalir en la vida. La siembra de papa, choclo y arveja es la actividad a la que se dedica Julián, todas las mañanas trabaja sus tierras para poderlas hacer más fértiles y productivas. Junto a su esposa trabajan muy duro, ya que saben que tiene que trabajar en todo lo que puedan, ya que la educación de sus hijos les demanda muchos gastos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden aquejarlos, lleva 16 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado de Tarma, que es donde vende sus cultivos. Dentro de unos días, espera cosechar sus productos y venderlos a buen precio en el mercado y así poco a poco juntar dinero, para poner una tienda de abarrotes por su barrio. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si no desea causarle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual es un socio muy responsable y puntual. Con los mil doscientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevas semillas de arveja y papa, también comprará sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Julián is 30 years old.  He is a very simple and cheerful man who lives in his own home together with his wife, 29 year-old Mery, and his two beloved children.  What Julián wants more than anything is to excel in life.

Julián's business is growing potatoes, corn and peas.  Every morning he works his land in order to make it fertile and productive.  Together with his wife, he works very hard.  He knows that he has to work as much as he can since his children's education creates a lot of expenses.

What Julián most enjoys about his work is protecting his crops from the insect infestations that can destroy them.  He has been in this business for 16 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be transporting his products to the market in Tarma which is where he sells his crops.  In a few days, he expects to harvest his products and sell them for a good price in the market.  This will help him as he is gradually putting aside money so that he can set up a grocery store in his neighborhood.

This is Julián's sixth loan from MFP and he knows that he must make his repayments punctually if he doesn't want to cause trouble for his community bank where he is a very responsible and punctual member.  Julián will use the 2,000 Peruvian soles he has requested to buy new pea and potato seeds.  He will also buy sacks of manure.

loans.use: to buy pea and potato seeds, and sacks of manure

loans.name: Rours' Group

texts.en:
Seventeen members form this village bank loan. Mrs. Rours is the village bank president, selected by the other members. 

Mrs. Rours and her husband are farmers who own a plot of land which they use to cultivate bananas. In order to support this farming, she would like to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers. The rest of the loan she would use to buy oil for supporting her water machine.  Her husband is a laborer who is able to earn a small income to help support his family. 

This couple has three children. One is a seamstress in the garment factory and the others are students and alS. support their parents' farming.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for growing bananas

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Zurite, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alejandrina; ella tiene 45 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de palos, ella vende en forma ambulatoria, ella vende a personas que viven en el distrito de Zurite, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de palos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar palos al por mayor. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Alejandrina, 45, is a member of the “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE” communal bank located in Zurite District which belongs to Anta Province, Cusco Department.
