She is married and has three children.  She alternates her daily chores with the sale of boards.  She sells in an ambulatory manner to people who live in Zurite District.  She wants to expand her board selling business and is asking for a loan to buy boards at wholesale.  She is happy about the loan and commits to pay her installments.

loans.use: to buy boards at wholesale.

loans.name: Ziliat

texts.en:
Ziliat N. is 50 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is single and has four children, none of whom are currently in school. Ziliat has a small retail shop business, which she has run for three years.
To help expand her business, Ziliat has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities, such as cooking oil, for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Ziliat hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities, such as cooking oil, for resale.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan, 37, is a hard-working mother; she is married to Mohammad who has retired from the military and is now working as a salesman. They have two sons to support. 

Hanan started making cotton candy six years ago; she bought the required equipment and started making, packing, and selling the candy. Her husband helps her selling cotton candy around the neighborhood. 

Now Hanan has applied for this loan in order to buy newer equipment to help her expand her business and open a candy store in the future. 

Her husband Mohammad wanted to appear in the picture with her to show his support.

loans.use: To buy newer equipment for making cotton candy

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa madre soltera, comerciante, sus hijos trabajan por cuentas propias, familia humilde. Su negocio de ventas de cosa de horno,  sus planes a tiempo futuro es alcanzar sus metas de ver a su familia prosperada, inicio con fondos propios, ahora vende mayores cantidades que antes requiriendo financiamiento para la compra de materia prima. Con el préstamo comprara maíz, dulce, leña, carbón, etc. Brindándole mayor oportunidad de trabajo. Agradeciendo por el apoyo.
texts.en: Rosa is a single mother and a businesswoman.  She has a humble family and her children work for themselves.  She has a business selling baked goods.  Her plans for the future are to reach her goal of seeing her family prosper.  She started with her own funds and now she sells larger quantities than before, requiring financing to buy raw materials.  With the loan she will buy corn, candy, firewood, charcoal, etc.  This will give her better work opportunity and she is grateful for the support.

loans.use: purchase raw materials to make baked goods.

loans.name: Nematjon

texts.ru: Неъматжон проживает в городе Душанбе. Ему 39 лет. Он женат. Детей, не имеет. Его жена, домохозяйка. Сам Неъматжон занимается торговлей. У него имеется магазин, где он продает стройматериалы. Его магазин находится на главной дороге. Поэтому он хочет купить холодильник для продажи прохладительных напитков на летний сезон. В этой области он более 8 лет. Кредит берет для приобретения необходимых материалов и покупки холодильника.
texts.en: Nematjon lives in Dushanbe.  He is 39 years old, married, and has no children.  His wife is a housewife.  Nematjon works in trade.  He has a shop where he sells construction materials.  His shop is located on a main street.  Therefore, he wants to buy a refrigerator so that he can sell cold drinks in the summer.  He has worked in trade more than eight years He is taking out a loan to procure necessary materials and buy a refrigerator.

loans.use: to procure necessary materials and buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: La Unidad 2 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Dayrani is one of the members of La Unidad 2 & 4 (The Unit). They are micro-entrepreneurs dedicated to selling items such as clothing, natural products, and shoes in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, an agricultural area.

Dayrani is the mother of four children, and they live together with her long term partner in a rural village outside the town. This is her first loan from Esperanza. She will use this loan to expand her product offerings, and to buy more. She has had her business for approximately three years. Her future plans are to see her children grow up and become professionals. Her biggest challenge right now is to raise her little baby. She enjoys working and being at home with her family.

Dayrani is planning to use her new loan to purchase different women's accessories like rings, earrings, bracelets, necklaces, belts, watches, wallets, etc. In the short term, she is planning to buy silver jewelry and cosmetics. She is very thankful for your support!!!

Note: The extra woman is one of their community leaders who attended the meeting to learn more about the group and the program. She is interested in being part of the group and getting a loan.

loans.use: to buy women's accessories and jewelry

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has operated his metal and welding shop in Naivasha town for the last four years.  He is 34 years old, married to Lilian and they have one child who is two years old.

He was introduced to KADET by one of his friends and this will be his second loan.  He repaid his previous loan of KES 15,000 well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more fabricating metals.

In future, Daniel hopes to grow his business and open more metal and welding stores around Naivasha town.

loans.use: to buy more fabricating metals.

loans.name: Lidia Sabina

texts.es: La señora Lidia es una cliente prácticamente nueva  vive en la zona de Bella Vista ella tiene una hija de 13 años de edad, ella es  mamá sola joven  con bastante ganas de salir adelante  tiene un crédito mas con nosotros la cual sacó para el traspaso de una tienda de lencería en la zona de san miguel la cual le esta hiendo bastante bien puesto que sus ventas han incrementado bastante ella vendía mas ambulando anteriormente en sus productos viene vendiendo mas de  dos años ropa de todo tipo y lencería, por la misma demanda ella requiere mas capital motivo por el cual esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de lencería por mayor, es una mujer dinámica y muy trabajadora, agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Lidia is a practically new client who lives in the Bella Vista neighborhood. She has a 13-year-old daughter. She is a young single mother with a great desire to get ahead. She has one other loan with the organization, which she took out for the transfer of a lingerie shop in the San Miguel area, which is going very well for her, since her sales have increased quite a lot. Previously, she sold mostly as a mobile vendor. She has sold her products for more than two years, including lingerie and clothing of all types. Because of the demand for these goods, she needs more capital, and for that reason she is requesting this loan to buy lingerie on a wholesale basis. She is a dynamic and very hard-working woman, and she is grateful to the institution for the support provided to her.

loans.use: to buy lingerie on a wholesale basis.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: La señora Eva elabora una serie de dulces para sahumerio (sahumerio es una tradición campesina donde se ofrecen dulces y otras cosas a la madre tierra) y su esposo es chofer. Así combinan  ingreso para mantener  a su familia. El crédito lo requiere para comprar harina, azúcar, colorantes para fabricar los dulces. Es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de las San Martín de la ciudad de La Paz. Eva se encuentra muy satisfecha con su relación con Kiva y esta es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito a canalizarse a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Eva prepares a series of sweets used for “sahumerio” (a rural tradition in which incense, candy, and other items are offered to Mother Earth). Her husband works as a chauffeur. Through these combined activities, Eva and her husband are able to maintain their family. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy flour, sugar, and food coloring for making sweets. Eva is married and has three children. She lives in her own home in the District of San Martín in the city of La Paz.

Eva is very pleased with her relationship with Kiva. This is the second time that she has requested a loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, and food coloring.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Despite the hardships of life, Marlene wants to continue managing her variety store in their village to supplement her husband's income. She is now 37 years old and has three school-age children. As responsible parents, Marlene and her husband want all of their children to finish their studies and find good jobs someday. 

However, due to financial difficulty they cannot provide for all their children's needs because of the high cost of commodities and school fees. Therefore, Marlene wants to increase her income to supplement her children's financial needs in school. She wants to ask for an additional capital of P10,000 to buy additional stocks of noodles, toothpaste, shampoo, candy, beverages, soap and face powder to sell in the village. She believes that the loan will help a lot to improve her variety store. She dreams that in the future her business will improve and that her children will all graduate from college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of noodles, toothpaste, shampoo, candy, beverages, soap and face powder to sell in the village

loans.name: La Nueva Union 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Bianca is a member of her group, La Nueva Union 1 & 2 (the New Union). Her group is based in the area surrounding La Romana, where the economy is based on the sugar cane industry and where there is little access to running water (none of which is potable) or stable electricity. Bianca makes her home with her two children and long-term partner, she is a young woman just 19 years old.

Bianca is excited to receive her first loan in Esperanza international, She was invited to be part of this loan by her neighbors, because she has a business. Bianca resells shoes after she buys them from a catalog; this brand of shoes is very popular in the Dominican Republic. Her clients used to order from the catalog, but Bianca also buys every month different shoes and sizes, and sells them by walking or promoting them to her clients. 

She hopes with this loan to make her dreams come true, to have a successful business and a good house. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Lenie

texts.en:
Lenie is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Lenie has a retail shop that sells snacks, beverages and canned goods. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.
Lenie is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Lenie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Jesús Nazareno Group

texts.es:
El comité llamado Jesús Nazareno está integrado por 17 mujeres muy trabajadoras. Formaron su grupo ya que le encanto la forma D. trabajar D. sus vecinas que forman parte D. otro grupo. Comentan que son conocidas en el barrio por la buena organización que tienen.
Una D. las miembros es la señora Enriqueta, quien es la Presidenta del grupo, comenta que todo su esfuerzo es por darle a su familia una vida digna y decorosa, sin privaciones como las que ella tuvo que pasar. Ella se dedica a la venta D. ropa, comenta que tiene muchos clientes que siempre compran D. ella, tiene muchos pedidos con los que le gustaría poder cumplir.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. prendas como ser camisas, pantalones y demás, lo cual le ayudará a cumplir con los pedidos D. sus clientes.Ella como las integrantes están muy satisfechas con los créditos que recibe D. la fundación, porque gracias a ello pueD. ir aumentando sus ingresos y D. esa manera ayudar al sustento D. su hogar.
texts.en:
This committee is called “Jesús Nazareno” and consists of 17 hardworking women. They started this group because they liked seeing their neighbors who were part of another group and how they worked. They say that they are known in their neighborhood for being well-organized.

One of the members is Sra. Enriqueta, who is the President of the group. She says that all of her efforts are focused on providing her family a decent and dignified life without the hardship that she had to endure. Enriqueta sells clothing. She says that she has many customers who always buy from her. They have many orders, so she would like to be able to fulfill them.

She is requesting a loan to buy clothes such as shirts, trousers, and other items so that she can complete the orders from her customers. Like the other members, Enriqueta is very satisfied with the loans she has received from Fundación Paraguaya. Thanks to the loans, she has been able to increase her income and help sustain her household.

loans.use: to buy clothing for eventual resale.

loans.name: C13015 Dufashanye Group

texts.en:
Eugenie is 37 years old and is married with one child who is 20 years old. She is the leader of this group, which is called "Dufashanye" in the local language. The group is composed of five women only. Eugenie is the first person on the left side in the photo. Eugenie sells groceries (cooking oil, salt, water, juice, etc) and she has three years in her business. Her business is open from 6 am until 8 pm every day.  

Eugenie has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via vision finance company in order to purchase more quantity of sugar,cooking oil,water,juice to sell. With this profits from the loan, Eugenie would like to satisfy the basic needs of her family, reinvest in the businesses and start saving for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more sugar, cooking oil, salt, water, juice, etc.

loans.name: Yendri

texts.en:
Yendri is a 69-year-old farmer married to Sarah, a 63-year-old lady. They have been blessed with eight children. They are: Simon, 45; Deky, 41; Yakomina, 40, and Adri, 36 who are married and work as farmers. There is also Matje, 38 and Mery, 34, who are both married; Ridwan, 32, and Ricky, 30. Yendri and his wife are living with six of their children. Simon and Deky live separately. 

At his current age, Yendri still has the spirit to work hard for his family. Yendri has a plot of land that he inherited from his parents. He cultivates rice, cabbage, chili and tomatoes. He usually works at the farm from early morning to evening. Sometimes his wife helps him. 

Yendri is planning to rent a plot of land from his neighbor for six years to cultivate more vegetables such as “kangkung,” water spinach, chili, tomatoes and corn but he needs money to do so. He is seeking for a loan of IDR 7,500,000. He would like to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide. He hopes that TLM will approve the application.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Ruth Elizabeth

texts.es:
Ruth de 22 años, es una persona muy trabajadora que ha podido salir a delante con la ayuda de Dios.
Su negocio es la  venta de ropa en la cual tiene muchas aspiraciones de crecimiento de su negocio.
El trabajo lo realiza sola, lo inicia todas las mañanas hasta las noches que retorna a su vivienda.
La dificultad de ella es la delincuencia y de no tener mucha mercadería, ya que ella no cuenta con lo suficiente.
Ella solicita este préstamo para invertir en el negocio, ya que se acerca la mayor venta del año que es en el mes de diciembre.
Su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda y que su negocio pueda aumentar económicamente.
texts.en:
Ruth, 22, is a very hardworking person who has known how to get ahead with God’s help.  Her business is clothing sales and she has hopes that the business will grow.  She works alone starting early in the morning and continuing into the evening when she returns home.

The difficulty she has is delinquency and not having very much merchandise because she lacks sufficient funds.  She’s asking for this loan to invest in the business since the year’s best selling season, December, is approaching.  Her dream is to finish building her house and that her business will grow economically.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Aracelis Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Araceli de 27 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de artesanía en lo cual en las épocas de lluvia le ha ocasionado problema, pues tiene que utilizar un horno en donde tiene que elaborar su producto, esto le ha ocasionado problema en sus ventas. Esta actividad la adquirió desde su niñez por lo que sus padres se dedicaban a este mismo negocio. El factor más importante   ha sido el  seguir trabajando en el.  Con este desembolso ella quiere comprar leña, pintura, barro, brocha entre otros.
texts.en: Sra. Araceli, 27, earns a living making and selling traditional craft products.  She needs her oven to make the products she sells.  Recent rains have affected when and how she can use the oven and that, in turn, has led to problems with what she can make to sell.  She learned the business from her parents when she was just a girl and she has been able to make a living from it ever since.  She will use this loan to buy firewood, paint, clay and other supplies she needs for the business.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her crafts business.

loans.name: Pisa

texts.en:
Pisa is a married mother of 5 children. She is 56 years old.

Pisa owns and operates a business venture selling both food & daily use products in the local community. She has many years of experience in this business. Pisa needs a loan of 2,200 Somoa Tala (WST) to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400WST or US$167 per week) to financially support members of her immediate family.

Pisa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Pisa fifth loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy artificial flowers and decorations

loans.name: Gustavo Alfonso

texts.es: El Sr. Gustavo es  cliente que  vive en casa familiar, de su hermana, el es mecánico,  soltero sin hijos. Tiene más de 3 años de experiencia en el rubro, esta cambiando de lugar su taller, por eso necesita el crédito, para dar un pago por adelantado para el alquiler de una tienda ya que en la tienda funcionara su  taller de mecánica ya que es un lugar estratégico para que funcione su taller, el cliente cuenta con los equipos y herramientas necesarias para su trabajo solo estaba en la búsqueda de un lugar estratégico  y gracias al apoyo de la institución conseguirá hacer realidad su sueño de tener su propio taller.
texts.en:
Gustavo lives in the family home of his sister. He is a mechanic, single, without children. He has more than three years of experience in this field. 

He is moving his workshop and this is why he is asking for a loan, in order to make an advance payment for the rent of the shop in order to carry out his mechanical work in a strategic location for his business. 

Gustavo has the equipment and tools necessary to do his work, and only was looking for a strategic place and thanks to the help of the institution he will achieve and realize his dream of having his own workshop.

loans.use: to make an advance payment for the rental of a workshop

loans.name: Ma. Jonep

texts.en:
Ma. Jonep is a 35-year-old married woman with two children ages 13 and 8.  She is a rice farmer and works in Talibon, Bohol.  Ma. Jonep also sells cosmetics to the people in her community.

Ma. Jonep has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and cosmetics to sell.  She hopes to have a stable income that will help her sustain her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria de 62 años tiene una lavandería de ropa en la parte delantera de su casa. Trabaja en ocasiones con su esposo cuando él tiene tiempo libre en su trabajo. También trabaja con sus nietos quienes le ayudan a tender la ropa. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio ya que le ayuda a su familia en los gastos familiares. Quiere continuar con su lavandería de ropa por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar con el préstamo una lavadora y detergente para tener más ingresos con la fluidez de clientes.
texts.en:
Maria is 62, and has a laundry in the back part of her house. Sometimes she works with her husband when he has free time in his work. She also works with her grandchildren, who help her to hang the clothing. She has many ambitions for her business, as it helps her family with the household expenses.

She wants to continue with her laundry business, and that's why she wants the loan in order to buy a washing machine and detergent. This is so that she can have more income by serving more customers.

loans.use: To buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en:
Rawan is a 21 year old married woman who has 2 family members from Al Salt,Al Balqa: Jordan.She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to pay for her home improvements,she wants to expand her home and she is planning on adding another rooms.In the future she would like to increase her family social economic status. 
Since Rawan is under 30 year old,her loan is considered a youth loan.
Rawan is a conservative woman,she is unwilling to upload her photo in the internet the photo is for her husband.

loans.use: to pay for her home improvements

loans.name: Hun's Group

texts.en:
Hun lives in a rural village of the Sithor Kandal district of Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She is 41 years old and married with two children. To support her family, she has been working as a rice farmer for more than 20 years while her husband raises pigs to supplement the income. The current business earns her about 50,000KHR per day to make a living and afford to save 20,000KHR each day after expenses. 
This is Hun’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Julio

texts.en:
Julio B. owns a shop in Guayaquil, Ecuador selling meat. He started the business by borrowing some money from his brother, and he has been growing it consistently ever since. Every day Julio works from 7am until 11pm and makes most of his money by selling at the big market near his house. He also supplies some smaller stores with meat. Mr. B. and his wife want to invest in a new grill for filleting the steaks, which he does most often. Julio is 45 years old and was born in Santa Elena. He has one young son, and his family lives in a modest cement house. Julio is hoping that he can generate enough revenue to save up for a car to start doing deliveries to all the stores that purchase meat from him.  

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Mr. Bustamante and his wife want to invest in a new grill for filleting the steaks

loans.name: Exito

texts.en:
Exito has a mechanics shop for auto body repair and paint jobs. Exito began his business after learning the trade by working in an auto shop with a friend for eight years. At first he just did auto repair. Now he also does auto body repair and auto painting. Exito will use the loan to invest in paints and tools. He's sure that with these new materials his business will grow. Exito is 42 years old, is married and has two children. He depends entirely on this business to support his family.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva volunteer Julie Lerch

Éxito tiene un taller mecánico de enderezada y pintada de carros. Éxito empezó su negocio porque aprendió del oficio en un taller donde trabajo ocho años con un amigo. Al principio solo prestaba servicio de endererezada. Ahora el ofrece este mismo servicio junto con pintada de autos. Éxito usara el préstamo para invertir en pinturas y herramientas. El tiene la seguridad que con estos nuevos materiales su negocio va ha tener un crecimiento. Exito tiene 42 años, esta unido tiene dos hijos. El depende completamente del negocio para apoyar a su familia. Éxito tiene la confianza que este préstamo

loans.use: Invest in paint and tools

loans.name: Zia Jan

texts.en:
Zia Jan lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. She has good work experience as a baker. She wants to help her family because her husband is mentally ill and her young son is in university and she wants him to complete his studies.

Because of this, she is working. She has a bakery in her house. She needs money and she wants to take a loan to expand her business and get treatment for her husband. She would like to thank AFSG because she can help her family now.

loans.use: To expand her bakery

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia is married and has five children, between the ages of three and fifteen. Her husband works as an employee in a furniture store, but the salary that he receives is insufficient to cover the basic needs of their family. Faced with this necessity, Leticia decided to undertake her own business selling hardware and construction supplies. Preparing a place next to their home, she began with material for plumbing and electricity, and little by little, she has been improving what she supplies at her hardware store. Leticia is willing to work a lot in order to give her young children a good education and a better quality of life.

To continue growing, Leticia is now requesting a loan of $475 dollars, which she will use to purchase construction materials that are in high demand from her clients. In this way, she will be able to offer better service and increase her sales. She promises to repay the loan in six months. The well being of her family is in your hands. Decide if you want to support Leticia. She greatly appreciates the opportunity that you give her to improve and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

Leticia es casada y tiene cinco hijos, entre 3 y 15 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja como empleado en una mueblería pero el salario que recibe es insuficiente para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, ante esta necesidad Leticia decidió emprender su propio negocio con la venta de ferretería, acondicionando un lugar al lado de su vivienda, comenzó con material de plomería y eléctrico, poco a poco ha ido surtiendo mejor su ferretería. Leticia está dispuesta a trabajar mucho para sacar adelante a su pequeños hijos, quiere ofrecerles una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida.

Para continuar creciendo, ahora Leticia solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en la compra de material de construcción que son productos muy solicitados por sus clientes, de esta manera podrá ofrecer un buen servicio e incrementar sus ventas, ella se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. En tus manos esta el bienestar de esta familia, decídete a apoyar a Leticia, ella agradece mucho la oportunidad que le das de mejorar y crecer con su negocio.

loans.use: Buy construction supplies that are in high demand

loans.name: Nahmen Gladys

texts.en: Nahmen Gladys F. is a 31 year old widow who has found it absolutely difficult to single-handedly educate and provide basic needs for her 4 children, coupled with the fact that she was a victim of robbery that made away with almost all she had. Motivated by these setbacks, she became a member GHAPE and received a loan of $40 in 2005 and $80 in 2006.With these loans, she was able to sell roasted corn, fresh groundnuts, and fruits and used the profits to educate some of her children. With a current loan of $500 and the training received from GHAPE, she plans to buy foodstuff in bulk from villages where prices are lower and retail them in the town so as to obtain maximum profit. The income will help her pay her children’s school fees and pay her bills. She plans to pay her loans in 18 months. The first installment repayment will be done from the fourth month from the date the loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuff, transportation

loans.name: Norma Luz

texts.es:
Norma is 39 years old and has 4 children. Her husband’s profession as a mason leads to periods during which he is unemployed. This situation led Norma to decide to open a small grocery store in her home, thanks to a small loan from Manuela Ramos. Given that the nearest market is 5 km. away, Norma also sells vegetables and other basic foodstuffs.

Her loan (which will be canceled in four months) will help her purchase supplies such as cooking oil, milk, rice, sugar, potatoes, onions and beverages.

Norma is very proud that her business is helping her to meet living expenses, as well as to be able to provide her products to other housewives in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Norma pertenece al BC Santa Rosa, del A.H. San Juan Bautista Mz A Lt 20 del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 39 años y es madre de 4 hijos, su esposo es albañil, a veces tiene trabajo y otras veces no, dada esta situación Norma decidió poner una bodega en su casa gracias al primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos. Dado que el mercado mas cercano esta a 5 km. también vende verduras y productos de pan llevar (primera necesidad). Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 2,000 (US$ 667.00 aprox.), que será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 1 caja de aceite, 2 cajas de leche, 2 sacos de arroz, 2 sacos de azúcar, 1 saco de papa, medio saco de cebolla, y 3 cajas de gaseosa. Ella esta muy contenta contar con negocio que le permite cubrir las necesidades de su casa así como brindar este servicio a amas de casa de la zona.

loans.use: Purchase basic food necessities for small grocery store.

loans.name: Mak

texts.en:
Mrs. Mak P. (age 50) and her family live in a small village across the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers north of Phnom Penh. Mak and her husband, married since 1977, have five children, three of whom attend school in their village.

Mak is requesting this, her third loan with Maxima, to buy thread for weaving and pay to set up her loom for weaving. Mak has been working at weaving for three years, a skill she learned, along with one of her daughters, from a fellow villager.

Mak's husband and son also make large (~150 liter) urns for storing rainwater. Her husband has been making these for more than twenty-five years. Mak hopes to continue to grow her business so she can support her children’s studies to the highest possible level.

loans.use: To purchase thread and pay to set up loom for weaving

loans.name: Mapatano B Group

texts.en: Grace, age 23, is married with one child (age 1 yr 7 months). She owns a tailoring business where she also sells laundry soap and fabrics. She began this business in 2002 and now makes a monthly profit of about $95. She works from 7am to 7pm daily. She now requests a loan to increase her business, which she will share with her subgroup member Agripina (a shopkeeper). Grace hopes to one day buy modern sewing machines for her business.

loans.use: To buy stock

loans.name: Sorayda Hortensia

texts.es:
Sorayda P. is married and has one son to take care of. She has a business selling food located in the beautiful city of León, in Nicaragua. She started the business when her husband's income became sufficiently low; she had always liked the cooking business since she sold out of her home every afternoon. She began the business five years ago, and since then she has generated enough income to maintain her home.

She has worked with CEPRODEL for the last two years, and told us that she feels very good about the credits requested since they have provided her with opportunity and been very flexible. They have helped her to get ahead, since through the income the business generates she has been able to improve her living conditions and has been able to make sure her son gets an education.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Sorayda P., es casada y con un hijo a su responsabilidad, tiene un negocio de venta de alimentos ubicado en la bella ciudad de León en Nicaragua. El negocio lo comienza cuando los ingresos que percibía su esposo eran bastante bajos, a ella siempre le gustó el negocio de comidería ya que en su casa se vendía todas las tardes, este negocio lo emprende hace cinco años y hasta hoy le ha generado utilidades para mantener su hogar.

Trabaja con CEPRODEL desde hace dos años y nos manifiesta que se siente muy bien con los créditos otorgados pues han sido muy oportunos y brindados de manera muy ágil, ya que le han servido para salir a delante, debido a que a través de los ingresos que les ha generado este negocio han podido mejorar sus condiciones de su hogar y ha podido lograr que su hijo reciba la educacion.

loans.use: Purchase of foodstuffs

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha is a single mother of two children that are 16 and 22. Since they were very young, Martha has worked to pay the household bills and her children’s expenses. There was a time however, that what she earned was not enough and this is when she decided to start her seamstress business. Little by little she became known and now makes uniforms and various articles of clothing for her clients.

Today she has many pending orders and doesn’t have enough material to produce them. This is why she is asking for a loan of $575 which she will pay back in 6 months. With this money Martha will be able to buy the necessary materials to fulfill the orders. With your help Martha will be able to help her children get ahead by supporting them as they finish their college studies.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

Martha es madre soltera de dos hijos quienes actualmente tienen 16 y 22 años. Desde que eran muy pequeños Martha a trabajado para poder pagar los gastos de su casa y de sus hijos. Sin embargo hubo un tiempo en que con lo que ganaba no era suficiente. Y fue por eso que decidió comenzar su negocio de elaboración de prendas. Poco a poco se fue haciendo conocida. Actualmente ya elabora uniformes y otras prendas para sus clientes.

Sin embargo actualmente tiene varios pedidos de prendas y no cuenta con el material suficiente para elaborarlos, es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $575 que está dispuesta a pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Martha podrá comprar los materiales necesarios para elaborar los productos. Con tu ayuda Martha logrará sacar adelante a sus hijos para que terminen de estudiar una carrera universitaria.

loans.use: To buy material to make clothes.

loans.name: Ni Putu Miarni

texts.id:
Miarni is a cow farmer. She likes this job and her husband is also very supportive. She feeds the cows early at 06.00 am with grass that she collected before. During the day, the cows are let loose to find their own food. In the evening at 06.00 p.m. she then gives them food again.

She wants to have more capital to buy more cows so she can improve her income.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Menjadi peternak sapi adalah suatu kegiatan yang tidak pernah ditinggalkan bagi Miarni karena Suaminya juga sangat mendukung dalam usaha ini.Mencari rumput setiap hari untuk sapinya adalah suatu pekerjaan yang sering dilakukan oleh Miarni.Bagi Miarni itu adalah suatu pekerjaan yang menyenangkan dan selalu ditekuninya. Setiap hari pukul 6.00 pagi sudah sibuk memberi makan sapinya dengan persediaan rumput yang sudah ada.Sedang untuk siang hari dibiarkan di kebunnya untuk mencari makan sendiri.Menjelang malam hari pukul 6.00 sore juga sibuk untuk memberi makan sapinya. Kegiatan ini dilakukan dengan harapan sapinya yang baru dibelinya tetap sehat.persediaan pakan hijauan tidak pernah kekurangan didesanya asal mau mencarinya di daerah sekitar desanya. Penghasilan memang sedikit namun bisa untuk membantu dan menambah pendapatan bagi keluarganya.Miarni berkeinginan untuk menambah jumlah sapinya agar nantinya keuntungan yang diperolehpun bertambah banyak.

loans.use: To buy cows (Membeli sapi untuk menambah populasi ternak peliharaannya)

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
Mr. Marco Antonio is a popular tailor in his neighborhood. He learned the trade from his stepfather, Mr. Pedro Rodríguez, by working for many years as his assistant. Two years ago, Marco started his own workshop with his own machines and capital.

Marco has many satisfied clients, due to his good workmanship and punctuality. He makes many different types of clothes, such as pants, jackets, and work uniforms.

Marco is now hoping to use a loan to invest in fabrics, as well as other inputs like zippers, buttons, and thread. A loan will enable him to purchase these materials in larger quantities and thereby obtain a discount. This will allow Marco to improve his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Marco Antonio es un reconocido sastre de su barrio quien aprendió el oficio de su padrastro el señor Pedro Rodríguez con quien trabajo mucho tiempo como ayudante y hace dos años se independizo formando su propio taller con maquinas y capital propios.

Cuenta que posee muchos clientes que están muy satisfechos con su trabajo, ya que además de su buena confección es un señor muy responsable y puntual a la hora de entregar sus trabajos. Realiza distintos tipos de confecciones como pantalones, sacos y uniformes para oficinas.

Hoy día Marcos está pensando invertir el crédito en la compra de telas al por mayor así como también otros insumo como cierres, botones, hilos entre otros pues al comprar al contado y en grandes cantidades obtiene buenos descuentos que le permiten incrementar sus ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, zippers, buttons, and thread.

loans.name: Zenelia Alaniz

texts.es:
Zanelia Z. is from Condega, where she has for the past few years devoted herself to the business of agriculture. More specifically, she cultivates corn and beans, a task with which she needs technical assistance in order to obtain a good, abundant harvest.

The purpose of her efforts is to provide for her little boy. For this reason, she has decided to invest in the improvement of her business by applying for credit at Ceprodel so that she can find technical assistance for her cultivation. Through this credit, she and her son will benefit given that the technical assistance will guarantee an excellent harvest.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Zenelia Z. es originaria del municipio de Condega donde desde hace varios años se ha dedicado al negocio de agricultura dando lugar al cultivo de maíz y frijoles los cuales les brinda asistencia técnica para al final obtener una cosecha abundante y en buen estado.

Sus fuertes trabajos que ella realiza los debe a su pequeño hijo que necesita de su madre por ser menor de edad, es por este motivo que comprometida con el bienestar de su hijo ha decidido invertir en el mejoramiento de su negocio por medio de la solicitud de crédito que ha hecho en Ceprodel para dar asistencia técnica a sus cultivos. Por medio de este crédito se beneficiara ella y su pequeño hijo ya que al darle asistencia técnica al cultivo garantizará una excelente cosecha.

loans.use: Technical assistance for cultivation

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Aminata Djitté is a 29 year-old widow with three children and has been a member of Bignona Water Tower village bank for the last two and half years. She wants to strengthen her business in dyed fabrics. Aminata buys fabric and materials in Dakar to dye and sell in Bignona. With her income she participates in her family’s spending and medical care. The loan she is seeking will be repaid with a single payment at the end of six months.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer

Aminata Djitté, 29 ans, veuve avec 03 enfants en charge est membre du banc villageois de Château d’eau Bignona depuis 2 ans et demi. Elle veut renforcer son commerce de tissus teintés. Aminata achète le tissu et les produits à Dakar pour faire la teinture et vendre à Bignona. Avec ses revenus elle participe à la dépense familiale et aux soins médicaux. Le prêt qu’elle sollicite sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.

loans.use: Making and selling dyed fabric

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris has been providing secretarial services in Arusha since 2005.  She is married with two children, ages 9 and 13.  She works from 8:00am to 6:00pm every day, which allows her to earn a monthly profit of approximately $70.  This will be Doris's first loan and she will use it to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Carmen Elena

texts.es:
Carmen Elena de Galdámez lives in Armenia, in the municipality of Sonsonate, with her husband and two children. The older is an 11 year old girl and the younger is a 6 year old boy; both attend primary school.

Carmen's husband sells metal structures and she sells cosmetics and beauty products. Because of the school fees for her children and the fixed household expenses Carmen doesn't get to spend that much time with her children; she has to walk around the nearby streets and neighborhoods trying to sell her products in order to earn a little more income. Thinking about spending more time with her children, Carmen dreams about putting up her own store in her house that would allow her to be more involved in her children's development. In search of this dream, Carmen is requesting a loan to purchase cosmetics, lotions and perfumes, with the aim of improving day by day the condition of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Carmen Elena de Galdámez vive en Armenia, municipio de Sonsonate, con su esposo y dos hijos. La mayor es una niña de 11 años y el pequeño tiene tan solo seis, ambos cursan su educación primaria. El esposo de Carmen vende estructuras metálicas, y ella vende cosméticos y productos de belleza. Por causa de los continuos gastos que provoca la colegiatura de los niños y los costos fijos del hogar, Carmen Elena no logra pasar tanto tiempo con sus hijos, y debe ambular en calles y colonias aledañas, intentando vender sus productos, para reunir un poco mas de ganancias. Pensando en poder pasar más tiempo con sus niños, Carmen sueña con poner una venta propia en su casa que le permita estar presente en el crecimiento de sus hijos. En búsqueda de este sueño, Carmen Elena solicita un préstamo, para comprar cosméticos, lociones y perfumes, con la mirada puesta en mejorar diariamente el presente de su familia.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics, perfumes and lotions

loans.name: Marian's Group

texts.en:
The Marian Group is named after the group's leader. All the members are businesswomen in Makeni, the northern provincial headquarters town. They have been a group with SMT for the past two years now and are now in their fourth cycle. Previously, SMT loaned these women Le 600,000.00 each. This they have repaid successfully, and they are now requesting a new loan. The previous loan made a big difference in their lives, but they still need more loans to further empower themselves in their businesses.

The group leader is Marian C.. Marian was born in Magburaka, Tonkolili District, in northern Sierra Leone, 38 years ago. She is married with two school-going children, both of whom are in secondary school. Both she and her husband, who is a businessman, are responsible for their children's schooling and welfare. Through her groundnut trade, Marian is able to meet most of her financial needs. She has been in the groundnut business for the past 15 years. Marian is doing fine in her business, but she still faces a lot of challenges. First, the amount that SMT's credit officer approved for her and her group members is not enough. She had wanted Le 1,000,000.00. This would have enabled her to purchase more bags of groundnuts, and as the dry seasoning is fast approaching, she expects a boom in business. Second, sometimes some of the groundnuts within a bag may be rotten, which means some losses for her business. However, with this loan of Le 800,000.00 approved for Marian, she will be able to buy at least three bags of groundnuts to add to her current stock.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Meas

texts.en: Mrs. Meas C. was born in 1949 and lives in Trapeang Krasang Village in Takeo Province. She and her husband, Mr. Ngaet Pon, have a piece of land on which they plan to cultivate rice. They have five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is a construction worker. The remaining three attend the local school. Although Mrs. Meas C.’s family members have different businesses, they still don't earn enough in total to afford building another room in their house. Thus, Mrs. Meas C. is requesting a loan to buy timber to add another room. Her husband is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy timber to build another room in her family home

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Blanca M. se dedica al negocio de venta de frutas en el mercado La Terminal de León. Ella se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a su negocio desde hace 20 largos años el cual ha venido desarrollando en su tramo y con la visión de crecer y expandirse para obtener mejores ingresos para mejorar el nivel de vida de sus hijos ya que es madre soltera.  

Por esta razón es que la señora M. ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito el cual será utilizado en la compra de los perecederos como lo son las naranjas. Es importante destacar que ella espera confiadamente en que Ceprodel le brindará el préstamo y así saldrá adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Blanca M. sells fruit at the market "La Terminal de León". She has maintained and developed her business with much effort for 20 long years and has the vision to grow and expand in order to obtain a higher income to improve the life quality of her children as she is a single mother.

For this reason, Mrs. M. has sought support from Ceprodel to get the benefit of a loan to be spent on the purchase of perichable goods such as oranges. It is important to point out that she trustfully expects Ceprodel to give her the loan and thus enable her to move ahead with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits

loans.name: Addul Rafiou

texts.fr:
Monsieur D. A. a un magasin ou il vend les produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2006.  Il a une fois bénéficié d’un crédit de 300,000 CFA ($600) au près de WAGES, qu’il a bien remboursé.  Ce deuxième crédit va lui permettre d’acheter 12 sacs du riz, 15 bidons huile, 10 cartons de pate alimentaire, 12 cartons de biscuits, 11 cartons d’eau minérale, et 10 cartons de pate dentifrice.  Il va acheter tous ces produits chez les grossistes au grand marché de Lomé, et les revend à Agoè, un quartier au nord de Lomé.  
Monsieur D. A. est célibataire et il a un enfant à sa charge.  Il est né à Kpalime, une ville située 120 km au nord de Lomé où il y a beaucoup de montagnes et cascades.
texts.en:
Mr. D. A. has a store where he has been selling groceries since 2006. He once received a loan from WAGES in the amount of of 300,000 CFA (USD 600), he paid it back completely. This second loan would allow him to buy 12 bags of rice, 15 drums of oil, 10 boxes of pasta, 12 boxes of cookies, 11 boxes of mineral water, and 10 boxes of toothpaste. He buys all these products at wholesalers at the large market in Lomé and resells them in Agoè, a neighborhood north of Lomé. Mr. D. A. is single and his financially responsible for one child. He was born in Kpalime, a town located 120 km north of Lomé where there are a lot of mountains and waterfalls.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat des produits d’alimentation générale

loans.name: Ngo Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Ngô Thị Bình 36 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2000. Ban đầu chị Bình vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi, nhưng sau một thời gian vừa chăn nuôi vừa học hỏi kinh nghiệm kinh doanh gia đình chị Bình đã mạnh dạn vay vốn để đầu tư cho  chồng đi mua lợn con ở các hộ chăn nuôi về bán cho nhà máy đông lạnh và bán ở chợ. Công việc kinh doanh thuận lợi đem lại cho gia đình chị  nguồn thu nhập ổn định 4 triệu đồng/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị Bình mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc buôn bán lợn của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs Ngô Thị Bình is 36 years old. She is a TYM fund member since 2000. In the beginning she used her loans to raise pigs. After a while she has learned the trade & gained experience in this domain, she and her family had decided to get a loan to start a new business: buy pigs from other entrepreneurs and resell to companies who make frozen food. They also retail pork at the market. Their business is good, they earn a good income at 4.000.000 VND a month. For this loan cycle, she is requesting 15.000.000 VND to continue investing in her family business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Juliette

texts.fr: Née le 30 juillet 1982 à Savalou dont Juliette G. est originaire dans le département des collines au centre du Bénin. Dame G. eut la chance d'être instruite. Elle abandonna les classes  en 4ème et apprit la couture.Après son diplôme de fin d'apprentissage,elle vint à Cotonou où elle a suivi une formation en informatique pour être opératrice de saisie.Après un an d'exercice du métier, elle changea d'activité et se lança dans le commerce de produits cosmétiques.A cela, elle a associé aussi la vente de boissons: bières et sucreries.Par ce deuxième crédit,elle désire non seulement renforcer son stock de mèches en s'approvisionnant en de nouvelles gammes mais aussi s'approvisionner en liqueurs de tous genres.
texts.en:
Born on July 30, 1982 in Savalo, which is where she is from, in Collines County in central Bénin, Ms. Juliette G. had the opportunity to attend school. She abandoned it in the 8th grade and then learned dressmaking. After earning her apprenticeship certificate, she went to Cotonou, where she got training in computers in order to be a data processor. After a year in this profession, she switched and got started doing commerce in cosmetics. To this, she added the sale of beverages: beer and soft drinks. With this second loan, she would like not only to boost her inventory of hair extensions with a supply of new types but to get supplies of all kinds of liqueurs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 12 dozen hair extensions, 3 dozen cosmetic products, 3 boxes of liqueurs

loans.name: Sosal

texts.en: Mr. Sosal Y. (left) is a villager in Bro Chum village in Kandal province. He is a construction worker. His wife, Mrs. Mao Chanthy (right), is a laborer who is a hard-working woman. Mr. Sosal Y. is applying for a loan to add to his savings to repair the house for his family. He is 30 years old and the parent of a child who is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To add to his savings to repair the house for his family.

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr:
G. Cécile est née le 18 février 1975 dans la commune d'ifangni à Sakété,département de Plateau. G. Cécile est mariée et mère de  02 enfants dont 01 est scolarisé. Cécile vit actuellement avec son mari à Takon dans la commune de Sakété, département de Plateau. Cécile est une vendeuse d'huile rouge  qu'elle obtient après transformation de noix de palme. Faute de moyens financiers, Cécile n'a pas encore pu développer son activité. C'est pourquoi Cécile demande un prêt pour y arriver.
 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
G. Cécile was born on February 18, 1975 in the commune of Ifangni in Sakété, Plateau County. She is married and the mother of two children, one of whom is in school. She currently lives with her husband in Takon in the commune of Sakété, Plateau County. Cécile is a retailer of red oil, which she obtains from processing palm nuts. Lacking financial means, she has not been able to develop her business. This is why she's asking for a loan.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program for recipients of micro-loans.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm nuts

loans.name: Hsien

texts.en:
Hsien is a 34 year old man who lives in Bourj El Barajnej, southern suburbs of Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Hsien has been working as a house painter and decorator since 1992. He requested a loan of 700 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his work. Hsien has been a microcredit client for seven years now and has always paid on time.

His previous loans helped him improve his work. Hsien's work is special because he does it well. His clients can be anybody from his region. When he first started, he had difficulty finding the proper place to open his shop. In the future, he plans on improving his work.

loans.use: House painting and decorating supplies

loans.name: Mr. Moung Thee Group

texts.en: Mr. Moung T. is a group leader of four members who all live in Sdau Kanlaeng village in Kandal province. He is a construction worker who only earns a small salary. His wife, Mrs. Oun Thy, is a housewife and now she wants to start a small business to earn more income for her family. Thus, Mr. Moung T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fruit for his wife to start a new business. He hopes to increase their income and improve his family's living conditions with this loan. He is a 59 year old father of four children who are employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: To buy fruit for his wife to start a new business.

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr: Mme A. Amavi est commerçante de bijoux. Elle a 35 ans, mère de six (06) enfants. Son mari est cultivateur. Malgré les efforts qu'il fournit, les champs ne donnent pas de rendements suffisants. La femme seule prend en charge les enfants et leur scolarisation. Elle demande un crédit pour s'approvisionner en marchandises. Elle est rigoureuse et honnête dans la gestion de ses activités .Les bénéfices serviront à améliorer leur condition de vie.
texts.en:
Mme A. Amavi sells costume jewelry. She is 35 and the mother of 6 children. Her husband is a farmer. Despite his best efforts, his fields don't produce enough. Only his wife is responsible for the children and their schooling. She is requesting a loan to replenish her stock of merchandise. She is rigorously honest in managing her business. The profits will be used to improve their living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and re-sale of costume jewelry

loans.name: Shahnaz Muhammad Iqbal Group

texts.en:
My name is Shahnaz and I have lived in Borewala, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Borewala is famous for its shrines. I operate a sewing business because I want to share the financial burden with my husband so he can pay more attention to his work. My husband runs a construction-supply sales business. He has been in this business for the past 8 years. He has a good number of customers who give him orders and he fulfills the orders on time, so he has developed a good reputation.  I am applying for a loan to buy construction supplies so that my husband is able to complete his customers' orders.

I’m the group leader of four other women from my area. Irshad baji wants a loan to buy items (tables, table covers  and chairs) for her catering business. Rafia baji wants a loan to change the body of her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Sugran baji wants a loan to buy timber to sell. Parveen Kosar baji wants a loan to buy tea packets to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy construction supplies to sell

loans.name: Yaya

texts.fr:
Yaya B. vend de l’huile de palme et au miel qui est une activité très rentable au sud du pays dans la région de la Casamance qui est le lieu d’importation de ces produits. Les revenus tirés de cette activité lui permet d’entretenir sa famille.
Avec le prêt qu’il sollicite, il veut acheter des quantités importantes pour l hivernage car en hivernage la zone est difficile d’accès.
texts.en:
Yaya B. sells palm oil and honey which is a very profitable business in the south of the country in the region of Casamance which is where these products are imported from. The income from this business allows him to support his family.

With the loan he is asking for, he wants to buy larger quantities to stockpile for the rainy season, because in the rainy season, this area is difficult to access.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying larger quantities to  stockpile for the rainy season

loans.name: Cell 8 Nampijja Clare Group

texts.en:
N. Clare is thirty years old, married with two children schooling, and also taking care of five dependents.

Clare has been operating a business dealing in used clothes so far for seven years. She is using the loan to purchase more used clothes, especially from Owino Market in Kyotera Town. There is a difference in her life because her standard of living is uplifted from where it was. Her services are closer to her community. She is an active lady whose dream is to purchase used clothes in much greater volume.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes, especially from Owino market

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie C., from the village of San Simon, Cagayan de Oro City, is a 35-year-old married mother of three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop whose main source of income comes from selling a variety of products in the local community. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Rosalie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having fully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

location.town: San Simon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Thach

texts.en:
Mrs. Thach L., 55, and her husband, Mr. Yun Choun, 56, live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1972 and have four sons. One son is married and lives in a separate home, and two other sons help their father in his wooden house construction business.

Thach has been a silk weaver since she was 15 years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to a middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Mr. Yun Choun has been building wooden houses for over twenty years. His business now is running very well and he needs some more materials to support his operation, but lacks money for this.
Thus, Thach is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase one more wood-cutting machine, to help expand her husband’s business.

loans.use: To purchase one wood-cutting machine to help expand her husband’s wooden house construction business.

loans.name: Marthe

texts.fr: F. Marthe est née le 29/07/1966 à Cotonou au quartier Guincomey, un quartier de la zone commerciale de Cotonou; où elle mène actuellement ses activités. Marthe est épouse de BACHIROU Moussedekou, mécanicien auto de formation. Moussedekou continue d’exercer son activité de mécanique auto depuis 25 ans. Marthe est mère d’une fille âgée de 16 ans qui est en classe de seconde. Marthe mène comme activité la vente d’igname frite et de beignets de haricot depuis 20 ans. Cinq ans après cette activité elle décide de diversifier ses activités par la vente de divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.). En vue de bien satisfaire sa clientèle, Marthe veut renforcer son fonds de roulement. Mais entre temps le mari de Marthe était malade et Marthe a dû abandonner la vente de divers. Vu l’amélioration de la santé de son époux et la forte demande des produits divers, Marthe décide de reprendre ladite activité. Pour y parvenir Marthe sollicite l’aide de ALIDé. Marthe est actuellement à son cinquième prêt avec ALIDé et rembourse bien ses prêts.

loans.use: Achat de 65 litres d’huile d’arachide, des condiments, de haricot, de tubercule d'igname et de charbon de bois; des divers.

loans.name: Clato Bwonya

texts.en:
Clato is 38 years old and married with four children. His animal farming business is located in Central Likuyani in Eldoret Town. Clato was introduced to KADET by a member. He has applied for a loan which he intends to use to buy a heifer. He hopes and dreams that he may increase his farm animals and also buy land for zero grazing.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To buy one heifer

loans.name: Ellan

texts.en:
Ellan L. is currently in the business of selling maize and cassava flour and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of flour to sell. Ellan is 32 years old and is married to a security guard. She has three children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of flour to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda I. is 44 years old and lives in Norala, South Cotabato. She has three children, the eldest of whom is 15 years old. Rosalinda makes her living from rice farming and is able to send her children to school with the income she earns from her 1.5 hectare rice field.

Rosalinda would like to request a loan from Kiva partner Community Economic Ventures, Inc. (CEVI) for 15,000 PHP. She will use the loan to buy supplies for her farm. It is very helpful for her to have additional capital for her business.

loans.use: To finance her farm, e.g. buy farm supplies

loans.name: Florence's Group

texts.en:
N. Florence is a friendly, hardworking and determined lady. She is 25 years old and the leader of her lending group in Mukono. Florence is married with a four-year-old child and she also takes care of some orphans.

Florence is a businesswoman involved in the sale of fish from Kiganda, and she is able to make a weekly profit of 50,000 UGX. This is a new business she started four months ago, and she is successful due to her cleanliness and friendly nature at work. Florence dreams of expanding her business and getting a much bigger place, as well as buying her own plot of land. She needs a loan to buy more dry fish for resale since this will bring in more income.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale

loans.name: Tống Thị's Group

texts.en:
"C. Tống Thị (10117050033) is a 55-year-old female living in the town of Đông Anh - Hà nội.  C. is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Đản Mỗ 1 (1).


C. is married and has two adult children.  To make a living, C. operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  The main source of income for the business comes from raising chickens for sale.  C. has been engaged in this business for over eight years and earns approximately $112 a month from these activities.


In 2003, C. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  C. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.300.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5.886.000 VND which will be used in the same way.  This will be her sixth loan from SEDA.  C. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Tống Thị M. (10117050032) is a 48-year-old female who is requesting a 2.834.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  Nguyễn Thị H. (10117050034) is a 35-year-old female who is requesting a 1.962.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide micro-finance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


C. Tống Thị (10117050033) là 55 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Đông Anh - Hà nội.  C. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đản Mỗ 1 (1).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán.  C. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 8 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, C. kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2003, C. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  C. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.300.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.886.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 6th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Tống Thị M. (10117050032) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 2.834.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị H. (10117050034) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 1.962.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Elkanah

texts.en:
Elkanah is 27 years old and has a livestock farming business in the Kiambu area of Nairobi. He sells milk and poultry meat and has two employees. He also earns some income through small-scale maize farming and a matatu (taxi van) business. He previously worked in the IT department at Safaricom. He describes himself as young and ambitious.

He requested this loan from Faulu for Kes. 40,000 to purchase chicks for poultry farming and feed for the cows and chicks. In the future, he hopes to buy more land for farming.

loans.use: To purchase chicks & animal feeds

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba M. sells palm oil, tomatoes and vegetables at a market near Abura. Aba has no educational background. She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a farmer. 

Aba has been selling palm oil, tomatoes and vegetables since 1990. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy tomatoes, palm oil and vegetables for sale. She hopes to reinvest the new profits from her business.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy tomatoes, palm oil and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Nefisa

texts.en: Nefisa Lasi K. is currently in the business of selling charcoal from her home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Nefisa is 40 years old and is a widow. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero, y vive junto a sus padres en el sector Casa Grande, distrito de la Arena, provincia de Piura, en la región Piura, ubicada a 3 horas y 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Hace 8 meses instaló en casa de sus padres un negocio de cabinas de internet (internet café), para lo cual adquirió cinco computadoras con los ahorros de su anterior actividad: el comercio de arroz. El había estudiado la carrera de Computación e Informática en un instituto de la ciudad de Piura y el instalar este negocio habia sido siempre la meta que deseaba lograr.

El negocio es de mucha utilidad para los estudiantes e la zona, que siempre recurren durante los meses de estudio a solicitar la búqueda de información para sus trabajos escolares. Elmer desea adquirir una  impresora multifuncional con la que desea brindar en adelante un mejor servicio, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más grande anhelo es ampliar su negocio para poder brindar un buen sevicio. El es un joven responsable, trabajador y muy empeñoso.
texts.en:
Elmer, 28 years old, is single and lives with his parents in the Casa Grande sector of the District of Arena, Province of Piura, in the Piura region about three hours and forty five minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Eight months ago he installed an internet cafe business in his parents house, acquiring five computers with the savings from his previous work selling rice. He had studied the Computing and Information Technology course at an institute in the city of Piura. Starting this business has always been the goal he hoped to accomplish. The business has been very useful for the students of the area who always come during the school year to search for information for their school work. Elmer wants to acquire a multifunctional printer with which he can provide better service in the future. For this reason he has seen the necessity of requesting for the first time a loan from Edpyme Alternative for 1000 new soles. His greatest wish is to expand his business to be able to provide good service.He is a responsible young man, hard working and dedicated.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a multifunction printer to expand his business.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo C. is a 58-year-old married woman who lives in Pinucotan, Calatrava, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running a general store and a sugarcane farm.

Amparo’s husband, Celso, is a 62-year-old carpenter and they have 10 children who are between 18 and 41 years old. Eight of the children already have their own families. The remaining two are single and help their parents in the business.

Amparo joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1993 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by operating a general store and a sugarcane farm. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 4,000 from her business activities.

Amparo is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 12,500 was used to fund operations of her general store and sugarcane farm, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 18th loan in the amount of PHP 13,500, which she intends to use on her general store and sugarcane farm.  Amparo is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Nean

texts.en: Mrs. S. is forty-nine years old and the good mother of a daughter who is single and working as a tailor. S. is a domestic grocery trader; she orders a variety of ingredients from suppliers for her store and resells them to earn income. To help feed her family, her husband works driving a motorbike taxi around the community. The income from S.’s husband has been declining because his existing taxi needs repairs and is not very attractive. Because of this, S. is looking for a loan that will allow her husband to replace his old taxi, so he will able to attract his passengers. (S.'s husband is in the photo.)

loans.use: For her husband to repair his taxi.

loans.name: Togetherness Group

texts.en:
Alpha K. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Togetherness Group.  He is 44 years old, married, and has seven children who range from four to 20 years old.  Alpha was unable to attend school due to poverty. For six years, Alpha has been selling charcoal at the Boaka Town Market, just north of downtown Monrovia.  He says he is friendly with his customers, which keeps them returning. Alpha plans to use his 10,000 Liberian dollar loan to buy more charcoal.  His goal is to open his own shop and to send all of his children to school. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Alpha is the one holding the sign.  Sanii B. is inset at lower right.

About LEAP:

The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country.  Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship.  LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase additional charcoal.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
