San P. E., age 46, is married and resides with her husband in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in a business selling various kinds of bed sets, earning approximately a gross income of USD 28 per day.  Her husband operates his motorbike as a taxi driver, earning USD 6 per day. They have been in these businesses since 1999. 

Their standard of living has improved since they have had these businesses, so they want to have a loan to expand their businesses. E. is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase a new motorbike for her husband. This is her third loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.

loans.use: buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Noel Antonio

texts.es: Noel Antonio tiene 44 años, por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, con capital propio y lo realizo con el objetivo de obtener un ingreso que es necesario para mantener a su hijo que está a su cargo. Pues siempre se ha preocupado por proporcionarle a su familia lo necesario. La comercialización de sus productos la realiza a las orillas del parque pues es muy transitado por mucho clientes. Fue este el motivo para solicita financiamiento que es para la compra de ropa interior, trajes, calcetines, pantalones y camisas. Su deseo es seguir adelante con su negocio y además proporcionarle mejoras a su negocio.
texts.en:
Noel Antonio is 44 years old, and for a living he has been selling general merchandise for more than 5 years with his own capital. It is his objective to obtain the necessary income to maintain his son as he has always been worried to satisfy the needs of his family. He sells his products outside the park as many customers walk by. Therefore he requests financing to be able to buy underwear, suits, socks, trousers, and shirts. It is his wish to get ahead with his business as well as to improve it.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson, 48, is living in Banga, South Cotabato and has a rice farming business.  He devotes his time to working in his 1-hectare rice field.  He heard about Community Economic Ventures, Inc. that offers financial support to entrepreneurs like him, and he later joined.

His business is continually growing and now he is requesting a loan of 6,000 Php.  This amount will be helpful to sustain his business with a low interest charge.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Ezinabala Development Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
Teddy N. is a 28-year-old female fishmonger. She has been operating her business for the last one-and-a-half years in Namasagali, Lugazi. In a month, she says she makes 100,000 shillings and is planning on buying more fish to sell to her increasing clientele.

Before Teddy became a fish monger, she had a retail shop businesses that she left to work together with her husband. With the loan, Teddy says she wants to buy more fish to sell to her ever increasing customers.

Teddy is the mother of two lively children. She has seen her kids through school, courtesy of her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Floreta B

texts.en:
Floreta B V. is from the village of Tubod. She is 59 years old, married, and has 8 grown children. To make a living, Floreta B owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2004, Floreta B joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid previous loans from PMPC, and is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase baby pigs to raise & sell in the future. This will be Floreta’s 8th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby pigs to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: Noor Suraiya's Group

texts.en:
Noor Suraiya is very supportive to her family; she is always ready to help her family in every possible way so that she can make their life easier. She is applying for a loan to support her son who wants to increase his income by buying more seasonal fruits for his fruit-selling business.

Noor Suraiya has three sons and all of them work. Her son’s increased income will enable her to save money for her elder son’s marriage.

loans.use: To purchase more seasonal fruits for her son's business

loans.name: Florentine

texts.fr: NOUTAÏ Florentine est née en 1973 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Mariée à SAGBO Claude, Florentine est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Mais un des enfants n'est plus à la charge du couple. Florentine vit depuis sa naissance à Filla à Porto-Novo. Florentine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple subvient ensemble aux divers besoins de la famille. Depuis une vingtaine d'année, en vue de faire face à ses besoins, Florentine prépare et vend de la pâte de maïs à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Florentine vend de la farine de manioc et de l'arachide grillé. Florentine achète ses produits au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo, et aussi au marché de Ikpinlè. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu trois crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés. Face à la demande nombreuse de sa clientèle, Florentine désire rehausser le niveau de son activité et répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle ; raison pour laquelle Florentine sollicite un quatrième prêt.
texts.en:
Florentine Noutaï was born in 1973 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Married to Claude Sagbo, she has four children, all of whom have been provided with an education. One of the children is no longer in the care of the couple. Florentine has lived her whole life in the Filla neighborhood of Porto-Novo, where she now lives with her husband and children. The couple provides together for the family's needs. To pay her expenses, Florentine has been preparing and selling corn mush from home for the last twenty years. In addition, she sells manioc flour and grilled peanuts. She buys her products in the Ouando market in Porto-Novo and in the Ikpinlè market. Florentine is an old client of ALIDé, having already taken out and repaid three loans. Facing high demand from her customers, she would like to increase her production and meet her customers' needs; this is why she is requesting a fourth loan.

Translated from French by Rachel Braff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of corn, manioc flour, and peanuts.

loans.name: Azizan's Group

texts.en:
Azizan is the mother of three children and the wife of M. R.. She is a housewife and stays at home to take care of her family. Her two sons work. They couldn’t get education due to financial constraints. Her eldest son is a tailor and the younger one works in a clothes mill. Her elder son has three years of experience in the tailoring business and sews clothes very well.
 
This family of five people lives in a three room cement house in a city named Borewala in Pakistan. Azizan has taken three loans from ASASAH and successfully repaid them. Every year she has maintained good credit behavior. With the profits from these three loans she purchased a cooking range for her kitchen to cook food easily for her family. Her daughter also supports her in cooking food.

Now she is applying for the fourth loan from Asasah for her elder son. He will buy an electric sewing machine with the loan and increas his earnings by sewing more clothes. 

This is a group loan.

Note: In this photo, Imtiaz (a group member) is showing her artificial flowers which she makes and sells by herself.

loans.use: To purchase an electric sewing machine for tailoring business.

loans.name: Sabina  Akeyo

texts.en: Sabina Akeyo is a 63 year-old lady, married to Noah Owino. They have three grown children aged between 29 and 47; all are married. Sabina runs a cereal stall at Kanyigombe in Rongo town, Western Kenya. She has been doing this business for the last six years. She joined Kadet Limited to get access to micro loans for her business. She is taking out her first loan of Kshs 5,000 ($62.5) and she intends to use it to buy bean stock. She believes she will get a good profit when she sells the stock retail. Her plan is to own her own cereal store with enough space to store her stock. She hopes to find a Kiva lender to enable her to realize this dream.

loans.use: To buy bean stock for sale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes O. is 44 years old.  She is married and blessed with three children. She has been a second hand clothes dealer in Magongo, Mombasa, Kenya  for three years. Agnes' business is successful and she is now borrowing her second loan from KADET. She plans to increase the stock of  second hand clothes in order to satisfy her clientele most of whom are residents and friends. Agnes hopes to expand her clothes business to other Mombasa locations.

loans.use: To increase the stock of second hand clothes

loans.name: Rosalinda Dano Group

texts.en:
Rosalinda D. is from the village of Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban Mis. Occ. She is 38 years old. Rosalinda is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Rosalinda D. Group.

Rosalinda is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda raises pigs to sell. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over 31 years and earns approximately 3800 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Rosalinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14000 PHP from PMPC. The previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 14000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be Rosalinda's 8th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. sells bowls and utensils at Elmina by moving from one area to another. Esi has not received any form of education. She is divorced and has one child. She is responsible for the well-being of her family. Her loan will be used to buy extra utensils to sell. She hopes to use the new earnings from her business to build a shop to display her goods in.

loans.use: buy extra utensils to sell

loans.name: Zayda Lisethe

texts.es: La joven Zayda A. es originaria del municipio de Santa Rosa del Peñón, actualmente se desempeña como coordinadora del Proyecto de alfabetización para el Ministerio de Educación donde tiene un año de laborar es el primer crédito que solicita en ceprodel para la compra de un ropero para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Zayda A. is a young woman from the town of Santa Rosa del Peñón.  She has been employed by the Ministry of Education as the Coordinator of the Literacy Project for one year.  This is her first loan with Ceprodel.  She will use the loan to buy a wardrobe to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a wardrobe

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria S. is from the city of Molicay Ozamiz City. She is 56 years old. Eleuteria is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Eleuteria owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating tricycle transport services. Eleuteria has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Eleuteria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eleuteria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from GDMPC. Eleuteria is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Eleuteria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
La  A.C. TRIUNFADORAS están ingresando a su tercer en el Centro Focal de Germán Busch.  Como grupo es relativamente nuevo, sin embargo, la presidenta es una socia que ya tuvo experiencias en otro grupo, las señoras piensan que esto les dará la oportunidad de tener a una buena líder en el cargo.

La señora  Marcela es una mujer de 33 años de edad, casada. El negocio de la señora Marcela es el de realizar venta de mantas.   Las mantas son una prenda de vestir muy apreciada e indispensable en la vestimenta de las mujeres de pollera.  Ella cuenta con un puesto en la zona 16 de Julio, un barrio popular y muy comercial de la ciudad de El Alto.  El crédito solicitado de Bs1500.- será invertido en la compra de mercadería.

Las socias de base y mesa directiva, también cuentan con negocios de demanda popular, como ser: Venta de golosinas, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, comercio de productos de belleza, venta de mantas, venta de abarrotes, venta de productos, ayudante de cocina, venta de ropa de mujer de pollera.
texts.en:
The TRIUNFADORAS (Victorious Ones) communal bank is starting their third cycle within the Germán Busch Focal Center. The group is relatively new but the President is a member with prior experience in another group so the women feel this will give them the opportunity to have a good leader at the head of the group.

Marcela, 33, is married.  She sells shawls.  These shawls are a valued and indispensable article of clothing for women.  She has a stand in the 16 de Julio area, a popular, very commercial area of El Alto.  The Bs.1500 loan will be used to buy merchandise.  

The regular group members as well as the members of the governing board have popular businesses.  Some are:  sweets sales, neighborhood grocery store, food sales, beauty products sales, shawl sales, grocery sales, product sales, kitchen helper and women’s clothing sales.

loans.use: To buy shawls.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou P. is from the village of Brgy. Balete, Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 51 years old. Marilou is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Marilou owns & operates a business venture selling fruits and vegetables.  Marilou has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marilou joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou is requesting loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Marilou from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda F. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 32 years old. Belinda is married and has 2 school-age children. To make a living, Belinda owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a transportation business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorela or habal-habal (a hired motorcycle which carries less than eight persons including the driver) services to local community members. Belinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Belinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Belinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase tools needed to provide service. Belinda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Belinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Dem

texts.en:
Dem E. is from Upper Lamac in Oroquieta City. He is 26 years old. Dem is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Dem owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing repair services to local community members. Dem has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Dem joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dem is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Dem from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 49-year-old married man and the father of two school-age children. He is from Lebanon. He established a car repair shop in 1995. He specializes in repairing the vehicle's paint and body. He learned this occupation from a local technical school. He works hard to cover the increasing costs of food, housing, and other family expenses. His income is needed to support his wife and two children. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new tools needed to increase his business level and be able to take more repair work. He is optimistic about his business growth in the coming year.

loans.use: To purchase new tools

loans.name: Virgen De Chapi De Yanacoto Group

texts.es: “Virgen D. Chapi D. Yanacoto”, es una D. las Alcancías más unidas que tenemos en nuestra agencia ellos trabajan desD. hace 6 años con EDAPROSPO, una D. las integrantes más  antiguas D. este grupo es Basilia, ella tiene 48 años D. edad es madre soltera tiene cuatro hijos y uno D. ellos es aún menor D. edad, Basilia se dedica a distintas labores como: vender pedidos D. ropa, venta D. cebiche y frutas, todas estas labores las realiza como ambulante. Además D. estas actividades, también realiza trabajos D. bisutería(collares,pulsera),  el pequeño ingreso que percibe D. estas labores le ayudan a cubrir los gastos D. educación D. su menor  hijo y los gastos D. las casa. Ella solicitó el préstamo a EDAPROSPO con la finalidad D. comprar materiales D. bisutería (muranos, ojo D. gato, piedras naturales, elástico y algodón) para hacer pulseras, collares que le solicitaron sus clientes, también buzos y camisas para la campaña escolar. A Basilia le gustaría mejorar la construcción D. su casa y para así poder tener un puesto D. trabajo propio. En la fotografía se pueD. apreciar a las 8 integrantes más  el esposo D. la Sra. Inés, él la acompaña a todas partes para ayudarla a movilizarse ya que ella tiene una pequeña discapacidad.
texts.en:
“Virgen D. Chapi D. Yanacoto” is one of the most united community banks that we have in our agency.  The members have been working with EDAPROSPO for 6 years.  One of the longest-standing members of this group is 48 year-old Basilia.  Basilia is a single mother with four children, one of whom is still a minor.  She works in a number of business activities such as: selling clothes to order, selling 'cebiche' (marinated fish) and selling fruit.  She makes all of her sales as an itinerant street vendor.  She also makes jewelry (necklaces and bracelets).  The small income she makes from this work helps her to cover her youngest son's education expenses and her household expenses.

Basilia requested her loan from EDAPROSPO in order to buy jewelry materials (murano glass, cat's-eyes, natural stones, elastic and cotton) for making bracelets and necklaces that her customers have requested from her.  She will also make sportswear and shirts for the back-to-school season.

Basilia would like to improve her home so that she can have her own work space.  In the photo you can see the 8 members of the group and Inés' husband who goes everywhere with her in order to help her get about since she has a small disability.

loans.use: To buy materials for making jewelry, sportswear and shirts for the back-to-school season

loans.name: Jannet

texts.es:
Jannet vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Pasankeri, de la ciudad de La Paz. Ella trabaja en una limpieza y también tiene un segundo trabajo en la pequeña pensión de su hermana. Está casada y tiene un hijo.
El crédito lo utilizará para terminar la obra fina de un par de habitaciones de la casa donde vive.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito de IMPRO y también de Kiva.
texts.en:
Jannet lives in her parents' home in Pasankeri district, in the city of La Paz.  She works as a cleaner and also has a second job in her sister's small restaurant.  She is married and has one son.

Jannet will use her loan to cover the cost of carrying out some finishing work on a couple of rooms in her parents' home.  This is the first time that she has requested a loan from IMPRO or Kiva.

loans.use: To cover the cost of doing some finishing work on two rooms

loans.name: Hezron Onyango

texts.en:
Hezron W. is a 40-year-old Kenyan entrepreneur from Kisumu, a city along the shores of Lake Victoria. He is married to Grace who operates a retail shop and they have three children aged 16,14 and 12 years.

For the last three years, Hezron has successfully operated a motorcycle transport business within Kisumu town. He makes a monthly income of 20,000 KES. When he desired to expand his business, he immediately joined KADET LTD to gain access to micro credit. Hezron has applied for a loan of 81,000 KES to buy another motorbike.

Hezron will save his future profits to buy another motorbike and provide for his family's basic needs. His desire is to own more than five motorcycles and to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ten sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is 25 years old and is single and hard-working. She owns and runs a restaurant and she has done so for two years. Rachel is requesting a loan in order to buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant. She plans to save her profits.

loans.use: buying additional food for her restaurant

loans.name: Riqueza Group

texts.en:
The communal bank "Riqueza" is in its fifth loan cycle at FINCA Peru. Its 10 members have businesses selling clothes, electronics, textiles, and vegetables. The group is taking out a loan total of 7,350 PEN. 

Elisa is the president of the bank, and is 23 and single. She has a clothes-making business and will be using her loan of 1,050 PEN to purchase fabric in Lima to make clothes to sell in Ayacucho. She has had her business for two years and has been with FINCA Peru for the same amount of time. She would like to continue to grow her business and sell more clothing.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to make clothes to sell

loans.name: Choun's Group

texts.en:
Five members form this group loan. Mr. Choun is the group leader. He was selected as the group leader by the other members. 

Mr. Choun was born in 1974 and is married to Mrs. Oem, born in 1982. They have three children who all are attending the local school.

Mr. Choun and his wife are recycling sellers who are able to earn a small income to support their family. In order to improve this business, Mr. Choun would like to ask for a loan to buy more recycled goods to resell. They also earn a living by growing herbs, and also as laborers.

loans.use: To buy more recycled items to resell.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “LOS ANGELES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sofia; ella tiene 49 años de edad y es casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos nutricionales, la socia vende en forma independiente y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de productos nutricionales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos nutricionales al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sofia, age 49, is married and has one son. She is a member of the communal bank  “LOS ANGELES”; the bank is located in the Cusco district of the Cusco province, which is part of the department of Cusco.

Sofia divides her time between her daily activities and her business of selling nutritional products. She works as an independent saleswoman and this business provides her with the means to raise her son. Sofia would like to expand her sales business and is seeking a loan in order to purchase nutritional products from a wholesaler. She is happy about the loan and is committed to repaying it in a timely manner.

loans.use: to purchase nutritional products

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret A. A. is fifty-two years old. She is widowed and has five children aged ten to twenty-four. Margaret runs a restaurant at a shopping centre in Kakamega, which is known as the sugar belt region for its production of sugarcane. She has been running this business for the last ten years and has managed to provide employment for three people. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she faces is the risk of food going bad for lack of refrigeration. However, she works very hard to keep her business doing well.

Maragret is using this loan of KES 70,000 to buy a refrigerator to store her food and keep it fresh longer. She hopes to grow her business into a big hotel at the shopping centre. She also sees herself buying a plot of land in the future and building rental units. She describes herself as a visionary lady.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to store her food and keep it fresh longer.

loans.name: Kefa

texts.en:
Kefa is a 37-year-old mom; she and her husband Ayed have four children. Kefa wanted to find a way to help her husband support the family, since she decided to stay at home and be a housewife. 

She found a good opportunity five years ago to open a vegetables and fruits store and let her husband work there, and that's what she did. The store is known for its fresh fruits and vegetables and is located in a good area where it can serve a lot of people. 

Now Kefa has applied for a loan to expand the store, and open another store in another area. 

Ayed, her husband, appears in the picture since Kefa is a conservative person.

loans.use: To expand a fruits and vegetables store

loans.name: Las Uvas 1 Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "LAS UVAS 1" porque en la casa D. una D. las integrantes donD. se reunen tiene varias plantas D. uvas verdes y así mismo conocen la casa como "la casa D. las uvas". Esta ubicado en Puebla, en México. El grupo está conformado por nueve integrantes. La señora Estela es una D. las integrantes del grupo, ella tiene 35 años, estudió hasta el primer año D. secundaria, es comerciante maquila ropa y tiene 2 hijos, ella inicio el negocio hace 10 años. Solicita el préstamo para la compra D. tela para la elaboracion D. pantalonD. vestir D. dama. Sus clientes la recomiendan mucho porque les gusta la calidad y los diseños D. su producto. Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente muy contenta por adquirir este prestamo ya que le brindan la oportunidad D. hacer crecer su negocio e invertir en más tela para su elaboración y así distribuir más facilmente. Quiere ampliar su cartera D. clientes para poder dar empleo a vecinas D. su colonia y apoyarlas y obteniendo D. este modo gente confiable. Con las ganancias que obtenga quiere seguir invirtiendo y darles una mejor D. calidad D. vida a sus hijos para que un día puedan ser profesionistas con mucho éxxito.
texts.en:
This group is called "LAS UVAS 1" because in the home of one of the members, where they have their meetings, there are several green grape plants and the house is known as "The House of Grapes".  It is located in Puebla, México.  The group is comprised of nine members.  Mrs. Estela, a member of the group, is 35, has a secondary education, and has been running a clothing business for ten years.  She has two children.

She is requesting a loan to buy fabric to make women's trousers.  Her customers recommend her often because of the quality and design of her products.  She is happy to receive this loan and to have to opportunig to expand her business by buying more fabric to increase production and distribution.  She wants to expand her customer base so she can employ neighbors in her community and help them get started.  She plans to use the income from her business to give her children a better lifestyle so one day they can be successful professionals.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make women's trousers.

loans.name: Upendo Kigogo Group

texts.en:
Alfred, who is in his early 20s, is single.  He has been a mobile banking agent for two telecommunication companies, Voda and Tigo, for two months now.

This will be his 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He wants to use it to increase his stock by buying more "Tigo-pesa" and "Voda-pesa". His dream is to one day own a pharmacy.

He will share this loan with his loan group "Upendo Kigogo" which has a total of 15 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy and sell more "Tigo-pesa" and "Voda-pesa" (mobile phone banking).

loans.name: Maria Eugenia

texts.es: La señora María Eugenia de 36 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de León , es madre soltera, tiene a su cargo dos hijos, ella se dedica a elaborar y vender tortillas de maíz, su nivel a académico es básico solo curso hasta el cuarto grado de primaria. Desde los 8 años de edad comenzó ayudando a su mama a elabora tortillas de maíz, junto con su hermana con el paso del tiempo se convirtió en un negocio familiar del cual ha sobrevivido ella, su hermana y su mama, de esta manera es que ha criado a sus hijos y pagando sus estudios. Hoy en  día su negocio lo tiene en su casa, ella vender tortilla en el mercado de la terminal de buses de León. Requiere el préstamo para comprar materia prima, como maíz, leña, para hacer tortillas. De esta manera ella podrá suplir parte de los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, hacerle más propaganda a su negocio pues en lo futuro quiere hacer reparaciones al techo de su hogar y su cocina que lo tiene viejo y deteriorado.
texts.en:
María Eugenia is 36 years old, and she lives in the city of León.  She is a single mother, and she has two children under her care.

She makes and sells corn tortillas.  Her education is basic; she only went to school up to the fourth grade.  When she was eight years old, she and her sister started helping her mother make corn tortillas.  With the passage of time it became a family business.  Her sister, her mother, and she have survived because of this business.  Through the business she has raised her children and paid for their education.

Her business is currently located in her house.  She sells tortillas at the market at the bus terminal in León.

She needs the loan to buy raw materials like corn and firewood to make tortillas.  This way she will be able to fill part of the orders from her customers and make more advertising for her business.  

In the future she wants to make repairs to the roof of her home and her kitchen, which is old and deteriorated.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like corn and firewood to make tortillas.

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Cherry is 35 years old and all four of her children are in school.

Cherry has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy fruit to sell in her food stall.

Cherry has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
La señora Sara tiene ya más de cuatro años dedicándose a la elaboración y venta de comida. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para comprar de equipo nuevo para trabajar como es acondicionar un puesto, comprar ollas para cocinar, una estufa espacial para restaurante y mercancía para el negocio. 
Desea superar su ingreso con esta nueva inversión y tener un local estable para su negocio y así tener más clientes quien le puede consumir sus alimentos. 
Con las ganancias que obtendrá de su negocio pagara el crédito, ya que su esposo el señor Juan José se encargara de los gastos familiares y escolares de su hijo con el ingreso de su trabajo en la construcción.
texts.en:
Sara has been engaged in preparing and selling meals for more than four years.
She is requesting a loan to invest it in new equipment for her job, such as installing air conditioning and buying cooking pots, a special restaurant stove and ingredients for her activity.
Through this new investment she wants to increase her income and to own a permanent place for her activity, thus gaining more customers that will eat her meals.
She will repay the loan with the income she will make with her activity, as her husband Juan José pays for family expenses and school fees for their child thanks to his job in constructions.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of equipment and ingredients for her activity.

loans.name: Gladis Sylver

texts.fr:
Client  âgé de 37  ans, marié et père de  trois (3) enfants dont l’âge varie entre  10 et 16 ans. 
N’ayant pas d’appui considérable  pour poursuivre ses études, il a crée une micro-entreprise axée sur la vente du ciment en détail.
Avec une demande aussi  forte, l’octroi du crédit lui permettra de renforcer ses capacités de vente. Il envisage beaucoup épargner dans le but de réaliser l’ambition de devenir distributeur agrée des cimenteries au niveau national.
 Responsable et exemplaire dans ses attributs de chef de famille, il entreprend des relations d’amitié et de bonne coopération dans sa communauté.
texts.en:
The client is 37 years old, married and father of three children aged between 10 and 16 years.
Not having sufficient support to pursue his studies, he created a micro-enterprise centred on the retail sale of cement.
Credit granted will enable him to strengthen his retail capacity to match strong demand. He is saving in order to achieve his goal of becoming an accredited distibutor in the national cement industry.
Responsible and exemplary with regard to his attributes as head of the family, he maintains friendships and strong cooperative relationships with people in his community.

loans.use: increase his stock with 3 tonnes of cement

loans.name: Kuuljan's Group

texts.en:
Kuuljan is the leader of this group. She is 46 and she is divorced. She has raised two daughters. The first daughter is in Russia and the second daughter helps her mom with housework. Ten years ago Kuuljan’s father presented her with a sewing machine, and since that time she has been taking orders and sewing Kyrgyz national clothing. In this way she earns about 3,000 soms per month. 

With money received from the loan she wants to purchase fabrics and dressmaking supplies which are needed for sewing. In the future Kuuljan wants to see her daughters get married.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and materials.

loans.name: Cecilia Margarita

texts.es:
Cecilia de 38 años, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa  propia, cuenta con servicio sólo de luz, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Zona de actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace 2 años Cecilia se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza venta de prendas de vestir, su negocio lo tiene en el interior de su casa, cuenta con su propia clientela, con los ingresos que obtenga en ambas actividades podrá brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar más productos de belleza  como prendas de vestir de moda para exhibir y vender a su clientela y así podrá obtener mayores ganancias para solventar todas sus obligaciones.  Cecilia es una mujer trabajadora y una madre que siempre trata que su familia salga adelante a pesar de las dificultades que a veces se presentan en la vida.
texts.en:
Cecilia is 38 years old.  She lives with her husband and children in their own home, where they have only electricity (no running water).  Their home is located in the rural area of Tambogrande district, which is part of the Piura department.  This is an area of agriculture, livestock, and handicrafts.

For the last two years, Cecilia has worked selling beauty products and clothes.  She manages her business from her home, and has her own customer base.  With the income she earns from both activities, she is able to provide a better quality of life for her family.

She has requested a loan of 1,000 New Soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy more beauty products and fashionable clothes to show and sell to her customers, and so be able to generate more earnings to cover all her financial obligations.

Cecilia is a hard-working woman and mother, who always tries to move her family ahead in spite of the difficulties that sometimes occur in life.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products and clothes for her business.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is a single mother with one child. She is 25 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez Misamis Occidental.

 May has a small stall in her home and sells fruit like bananas to earn a living. She has had this business for three years. She earns PHP 1,500 a month. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional bananas to sell and a portion of her loan will purchase goods to sell like shampoo, sugar, eggs and other basic needs to earn more income.

May has been a member of GDMPC for about one year. In the future, May hopes to expand her business of fruit vending and build a sari-sari store or general store not only in her place but in other places.


About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

GDMPC people empowering people.

loans.use: to purchase bananas, shampoo, sugar, eggs and other basic needs to sell

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr: Son activité principale est le maraîchage, habitant dans une ville proche de la capitale du Sénégal. Il s'active depuis plus de 10 ans dans ce domaine qu'il a hérité de son père. Ce prêt à pour but de financer l'achat de de machine pour l'aspiration de l'eau qui lui permettra d'arroser son champ et d'acheter de l'engrais pour son champ. Avec ce crédit il veut voir son revenu augmenter et appuyer ses petits frères dans leurs études
texts.en: This borrower's main business activity is small-scale truck farming (market gardening).  He lives in a town near the capital of Senegal.  He has been working in this business, which he inherited from his father, for more than ten years.  He plans to use this loan to buy a machine for pumping water which will allow him to water his field.  He also plans to buy fertilizer for his field.  Through this loan, he would like to see his income increase and be able to support his younger brothers in their education.

loans.use: to buy a machine for pumping water

loans.name: Abel

texts.es: Abel e Iris son una pareja que  tiene  cuatro años D.   casados y tienen un pequeño hijo el cual  es  lo mas importante  en su   vida, día  con día  ellos se  esfuerzan por  brindarle  a  su  pequeño  una   excelente  estabilidad, en esta  ocasión ellos   solicitan D. nuestro  apoyo  para L. realización D.  su proyecto   el  cual consiste en realizar una  mejora  en su   vivienda  tal  como  colocar   vitropiso   en  el interior D.  su casa, ve  en el crédito L.  posibilidad  D.  ofrecer  a   sus   familiares  y amigos  una  excelente   estabilidad  cuando0o  lo  visitan.
texts.en:
Abel and Iris are a couple who have been married for four years. They have a young son who is the most important thing in their lives.  Day after day, they do their best to proviD. their little one with good stability.

On this occasion they are applying for our help in undertaking a home improvement project. It consists of installing tile in the interior of their house. They see in the loan the opportunity of offering their family members and friends a stable household when they visit.

loans.use: To install tile in the interior of his house.

loans.name: Aidyn's Group

texts.en:
Aidyn is the leader of this group. She is 35 and her husband works in Russia; therefore, she takes care of their children by herself.  She has two sons and a daughter; all the children study at school. AIdyn works as a laboratory assistant. Ten years ago with an initial investment of 5,000 soms she started to breed livestock. At the moment she keeps fifteen goats and she wants to increase the number of livestock. For this purpose she applied for the loan. With money received from the loan Aidyn wants to purchase three sheep. In the future she plans to save money to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Luci Marcia

texts.es:
Marcia pertenece al banco comunal “Tesoritos del Manu” y las reuniones de las socias del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la ciudad de Salvación provincia de Manu departamento de Madre de Dios. 

Marcia tiene 40 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo, ella nació en la ciudad de Salvación y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació y donde desarrolla sus actividades económicas. Su principal actividad económica Marcia es la venta de abarrotes y otras cosas más. Ya son cinco años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  

En esta oportunidad Marcia requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar, sacos de arroz y otras cosas más.  

Marcia agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Marcia belongs to the “Tesoritos del Manu” communal bank.  The bank’s meetings take place monthly in the city of Salvación in Manu Province, Madre de Dios Department.

Marcia is 40 years old and in a common law relationship; she has a son.  She was born in the city of Salvación and still lives in the city of her birth where she carries out her economic activities.  Her main economic activity is selling groceries and other things.  She’s been doing this for five years and does well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

On this occasion Marcia needs the loan to buy merchandise like for example: sacks of sugar, sacks of rice and other things.  Marcia is grateful for and values the loan and commits to make her monthly installment payments.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Ramon Alejandro

texts.es: Las naranjas , bananos , piña, dulces mangos, manzanas , peras y abejas en busca de dulces frutos son parte de los acompañantes del diario vivir de don Ramón conocido como Moncho , tiene 51 años de edad, es originario de Jinotega pero vive en Esteli donde en una esquina del parque central de la cuidad tiene un pequeño tramo de frutas , cada mañana desde muy tempranas horas sale al mercado e busca de frutas frescas y jugosas para colocarla en su mesas de plásticos y vender a todo aquel que pasa por su tramito , la mayoría de sus clientes son trabajadores y estudiantes que pasan comprando su desayuno frutal de todos los días. Lleva 21 años dedicándose a esta actividad, en base a este trabajo termino de criar a la mayoría de sus 8 hijos de los cuales  hay uno que todavía lo tiene en la escuela mientras su esposa se dedica al hogar. El requiere el préstamo para comprar frutas tales como manzanas, uvas, peras, que son productos que no son cosechados en el país y que por tanto son caros, y son buscados por sus clientes e invertir en compra de snacks y gaseosas para diversificar su negocio. Este crédito le ayudara a comprar sus productos mas rápidamente y no perder de vender por falta de productos por lo pronto desea hacer crecer su negocio y terminar de preparar a su hijo.
texts.en:
Oranges, bananas, pineapples, mangos, apples, pears and bees in search of sweet fruit are part of the daily life of Ramón (who is known as Moncho).  Ramón is 51 years old and from Jinotega.  However, he lives in Estelí where he has a small fruit stall on a corner of the city's central park.  Very early every morning he goes out to the market in search of fresh and juicy fruit to put on his plastic tables and sell to everybody who passes by his stall.  Most of his customers are workers and students who pass by and buy their breakfast of fruit every day.  Ramón has been in this business for 21 years and, as a result of his work, he has finished raising most of his 8 children.  Only one child is still in school.  Ramón's wife looks after their home.

Ramón needs this loan to buy fruit such as apples, grapes and pears which are products that are not harvested in their country and so are expensive and in demand with his customers.  He would also like to buy snacks and soda to diversify his business.  This loan will help him to buy his products more quickly and not lose sales through a lack of products.  He soon hopes to grow his business and finish educating his son.

loans.use: to buy fruit such as apples, grapes and pears, and to invest in buying snacks and soda

loans.name: Levik

texts.en:
Levik is 55 years old. He lives in the Geghamavan village in the Sevan area with his wife, who is a housewife, and his son, who is a disabled person. Levik is a veterinarian. For many years Levik worked in Armenia and Uzbekistan and not only performing his specialty. 

Since 2008 Levik and his wife have been engaged in cattle breeding. Part of what is produced (meat, milk, cheese, butter) they use for their family, but for the most part they sell what they produce to procurement agencies to provide for their family. 

This is Levik’s third loan from Nor Horizon and he always makes his repayments on time.
 
Levik intends to develop his farm and therefore he is seeking a loan for 1,000,000 Armenian drams (AMD) to buy 8 sheep and 1 pig for his farm. He will also buy fodder for his cows and calves.

loans.use: to buy 8 sheep and 1 pig for his farm and fodder for his cows and calves

loans.name: Duo Bendicion Del Campo Group

texts.es:
DUO  BENDICION DEL CAMPO
Este grupo está formado doña Sonia Yanira de 48 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos, y es vendedora de ropa de bebe, desde hace 6 años, nos cuenta que solicita este crédito para poder incrementar su venta ya que en esta época navideña la ropa de bebe es muy solicitada, también esta doña Blanca de 51 años de edad, ella es casada, y tiene 4 hijos,la lider del grupo y es dueña de una panadería desde hace 8 años, nos cuenta que esta solicitando este crédito para poder comprar harina de pan,  leña y algunos otros materiales para la elaboración del pan, ya que en este tiempo, los pedidos de pan se incrementan por motivo de las fiestas navideñas, entonces los clientes encargan pan, tortas y algunos otros panes de la época y por lo tanto necesitan arina, y solo en este tiempo pueden comprar material a buen precio de lo contrario se eleva el precio o ya no pueden conseguir por lo tanto esperan que se les pueda otorgar este crédito ya ellas lo están necesitando y esperan cumplir con todos los pagos que sean requeridos.
texts.en:
DUO BENDICION DEL CAMPO

One member of the duo is Sonia Yanira who is 48 years old, married and has 2 children. She has been selling baby clothing for the past 6 years. She tells us that she asks for this loan to be able to increase her sales, as during the Christmas season baby clothing is very sought after. 

Also in the duo is Blanca who is 51 years old. She is married and has 4 children. She is the group leader and has been the owner of a bakery for the past 8 years. She tells us that she is asking for this loan to be able to buy flour, firewood and some other materials for preparing bread, as at this time of year bread orders increase due to the Christmas celebrations. At this time of year her customers order bread, cakes and other seasonal breads and due to this she needs flour, which she can only buy at a good price now, otherwise it is impossible to meet the price increases. Therefore, they hope that they are conceded this loan as they need it and they hope to comply with all the payments required.

loans.use: to buy flour and firewood for the preparation of bread.

loans.name: Maria Emelda

texts.es:
La señora Maria tiene 47 años de edad, vive en la comunidad del el caimito y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion, Maria vive con sus dos hijos, es viuda su esposo fallecio hace dos años.
Maria tiene muchos deseos de superarse, ahora le toca todo sola, pero tiene muchas fuerzas para trabajar y salir adelante.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria, granos basicos, lacteos, enbutidos y refrescos, desea surtir su negocio para la epoca de navidad.
Su deseo es que sus demas familiares esten bien, todos viven en los estados unidos.
texts.en:
Maria is 47 years old widow, she lives in the El Caimito community and she engages in selling basic necessities. She runs a corner shop in her own house, where she lives with her two children. Her husband died two years ago.
Maria strongly wants to improve herself: right now she has to do everything on her own, but she is strong enough to work and to keep on providing for her family.
The loan she is requesting will be used to buy general products such as basic grains, dairy products, sausages and drinks. She wants to stock up her shop for the upcoming Christmas season.
Her wish is for all of her relatives, all residing in the United States, to live a good life.

loans.use: To buy general products such as basic grains, dairy products, sausages and drinks.

loans.name: Bashiran's Group

texts.en:
Bashiran is a 49-year-old lady who is a private job holder. She does this work to financially contribute to the family. She earns on a monthly basis and she utilizes her earnings to manage the household expenses. 

Bashiran’s husband has been a rickshaw driver for the last 15 years. He owns a rickshaw, which he drives for almost 9 – 10 hours a day. He provides transport facilities to the passengers and drops them off at their designated places. He charges them area wise. In this way, he puts three meals on the table for the family. 

Bashiran has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, he will repair his rickshaw’s engine because it is creating problem for him while he is driving. She is hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to her husband’s business and help him to continue his business.

loans.use: To repair a rickshaw engine

loans.name: Sandra Yamileth

texts.es:
La señora Sandra tiene 35 años de edad, vive en la colonia Obrera y se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas desde hace 10 años, en estos momentos inicio la venta de refrescos de cola helados en diferentes tamaños y sabores, muchas personas compran dicho producto ya que esta zona es muy caliente y los refrescos helados se venden muy bien.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de refrescos, desea tener mas inventario ya que los camiones que reparten dicho producto solo pasan una vez por semana.

las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra is 35 years old. She lives in the suburb of Obrera and has been dedicated to the production and sale of tortillas for ten years. At this time, she has started selling cold cola refreshments in different sizes and flavors. Many people buy said product since this area is very hot and the cold refreshments sell very well.

The loan will be used to purchase the drinks. She wishes to have more inventory since the trucks that bring the product only come through once a week.

She needs the income in order to get her family ahead.

loans.use: to purchase refreshments in various sizes.

loans.name: Jesuwanou Group

texts.fr: JESUWANOU est un groupe  est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même zone. Claire, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 28 ans n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Claire n’est pas mariée et n’ pas d’enfant.  Claire vit seule, elle assure seule les diverses de la maison. Pour y arriver, Claire prépare du riz accompagné de sauce qu’elle vend depuis une douzaine d’année à son domicile. Claire s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. C’est la huitième fois que Claire ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUWANOU, sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé, dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des condiments et de l'huile végétale.

loans.name: Agness

texts.en: Agnes lives in Kitunda area of Dar es Salaam.She is married with nine children.Four are in primary school and  two are in Secondary school.Agnes keeps Chicken both broilers and layers.She supplies chicken meet and eggs to different private hospitals in Temeke district of Dar es Salaam.She has six years in this business.Limited with  capital Agnes fails to meet demand from her customers. The additional capital of USD 750 will help her suffice this requirement.The expansion strategy will help her  increase income .Next year her third born will join secondary school the extra income will facilitate for school fees.

loans.use: WORKING CAPITAL

loans.name: Lusekelo

texts.en: Lusekelo lives in the Vituka area in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She is married with six children. She owns a shop selling soft drinks both retail and wholesale. She has another business, which her sister is in charge of, selling fruit and vegetables. The soft drink business has higher turnover in her shop, mainly caused by the hot weather of Dar es Salaam. Demand for soft drinks is high, and Lusekelo can not meet this demand. She is in need of USD 1,200 as working capital to meet her expectations. She has a challenge meeting school expenses for her children.

loans.use: Add stock of cold drinks.

loans.name: Nhan

texts.en: Nhan and her mother work as farmers and also as day laborers to get more money to support their family with the hope of having a better future. They want to borrow $75 to buy a cow to save for their chidren’s school and they will pay it back during 10 months.

loans.use: Nhan would like to buy a cow to save money to send her children to school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To boost his stock

loans.name: Juanita Maria

texts.es:
Juanita is 49 years old and has 3 kids. She lives in Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma in the Calleria district in the county of Ucayali. Her husbnd is a construction worker, but what he earns does not meet their household costs. It is for this reason that she decided to help out to improve their finances.

When she hard about the Manuela Ramos service in the Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma she decided to ask for a loan of S/.300 (approx. $94). She then used this to start selling drinks in the school which is about a kilometre and a half from her house. With time, she decided to start selling snacks too such as tamales, Juanes and humitas. For this she counts on being mobile (having a car in this case) so that she can transport the food to sell at the school. This car was fixed up by her son. She now does this business with him.

She will use this loan, authorized by Manuela, of S/.2,000 (approx. $630) to buy 5 kilos of rice (to make the juane), 2 chickens, 25 dozen choclos, 50 banana leaves, and to pay her son for the maintenance of the car.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Juanita tiene 49 años y 3 hijos, pertenece al Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma, del Distrito de Calleria, Departamento de Ucayali. Su esposo es albañil pero lo que gana no alcanza para los gastos de casa, es así que ella decide ayudarlo para mejorar su economía. Cuando conoce del servicio de Manuela Ramos se incorpora al Banco Comunal Ricardo Palma y solicita un primer préstamo de S/. 300 (US$ 94.00 aprox.), con ello empezó a vender bebidas en un colegio que esta a un kilómetro y medio de su casa, pero con el transcurrir del tiempo deciden incorporar la venta de comida como Juanes, humitas, tamales, para ello tenia que contar con movilidad (motocar) que le permitiera llevar la comida para la venta en el colegio, dicha movilidad fue proporcionada por su hijo. Ahora conjuntamente con su hijo atienden este negocio. El préstamo recientemente otorgado por Manuela de S/. 2,000 (US$ 630.00 aprox.) servirá para la compra de 5 kilos de arroz (para la elaboración del juane), 2 pollos, 35 docenas de choclo, 50 hojas de bijao, y para dar mantenimiento al motocar de su hijo.

loans.use: To buy ingrediemts and to pay for the maintenance of the car/Compra de insumos. Mantenimiento de motocar.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary I. is 32 years old, has nine children, and lives in Asaba main town in Delta State. She learned her business from her mother and started her own business in 1987. Mrs. I. is asking for a loan of $400 to buy more provision and foodstuffs for sale. She has been with LAPO for 7 years and thanks you for your generosity.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and food for sale

loans.name: Norn

texts.en:
Ms. S. Norn is twenty-six years old. She is single and lives with her parent. Norn learned to weave in 1990 from someone in her neighboring village. After working for a year, her skill level was good enough to start weaving independently. She did not finish primary school. Her father is a farmer, and the income of the family not only depends on her weaving but also on her father growing rice and raising animals.

Norn is requesting her second loan from MAXIMA, in the amount of $200. She will use this loan to purchase one buffalo for her father's business of growing rice.

loans.use: To buy one buffalo for growing rice

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz, is a sweet mother who works with much joy in her small warehouse, in wich she feels very happy. Her work helps her to forget the painful memories of being abandoned by her mate. She started to sell groceries to educate her son and to resolve the expenses of her home. Luz lives in her mother’s house who is an old lady so she helps to take care of her as well.

Luz wants to expand her business and to stabilize her income so she can provide for her family. She is asking for a loan of $350 that she will pay off in six months.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva volunteer.

Luz, es una dulce madre que se desempeña con mucha alegría en su pequeña bodega, en ella se siente muy feliz y su labor en este lugar le ha hecho olvidar los recuerdos dolorosos que le dejó el abandono de su pareja.Ella empezó a dedicarse a la venta de abarrotes para educar a su hijo y solventar los gastos de su hogar; teniendo en cuenta que se fue a vivir a la casa de su madre ya anciana también vela por el bienestar de ella..El deseo por aumentar su negocio y por estabilizar su nivel de ingreso son los planes que la motivan. Por esta razón solicita vuestra ayuda a fin de alcanzar la suma que solicita para poner en marcha cada uno de sus proyectos en bienestar de su familia.

loans.use: Capitalize her business.

loans.name: Maria De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria E. is a fighter, a married mother that has supported her three children always working in the sale of prepared food. She sells out of her home which is her place of business. With the small income from her sales she has slowly improved her business being able to offer more variety to her loyal customers.

Mrs. E. has received eighteen loans through Ceprodel, maintaining an excellent credit record. This has helped her to start construction on her place of business and also obtain raw material for her food preparation. Currently her record is of eighteen loans, all repaid on time and according to the established agreements.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Maria E. es una mujer muy luchadora, madre casada que ha mantenido a sus tres hijos trabajando siempre en la venta de comida. La venta la realiza en su casa que es el local donde su negocio se ubica. Con el poco ahorro de sus ventas decide ir mejorando poco a poco su negocio para ofrecer mas variedad de alimentos a su fiel clientela que tanto lo necesita.

La señora E. ha sido beneficiada por Ceprodel con dieciocho créditos teniendo un excelente record crediticio que le ha ayudado a comenzar a construir su local y a la vez para la compra de la materia prima de los alimentos. Actualmente su record es de 18 creiditos pagados en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido.

loans.use: Purchase of food ingredients

loans.name: Moata A Centre - Group 1

texts.en:
Luaono P. was selling her taro, bananas, and vegetables by the roadside when a small vehicle pulled up and asked her if there were many ladies like her selling their products by the roadside. She replied that there are a bunch who alternate throughout the week. The driver then introduced herself as SPBD staff and informed her that the organization helps women start up or expand their businesses through a credit and savings scheme. Luaono got excited about the prospects and told her friends and neighbors about SPBD expanding to their village. She lost no time calling up SPBD and scheduled a village meeting with the staff. The village meeting was done a few days before Christmas last year.

Moata village is a farming village just a few kilometers away from the capital town of Salelologa on Savaii Island. A small group of women were so interested that they started their SPBD training early this year. They were taught how to save, prepare simple business plans and budgets, and organize themselves into a village group. They have successfully finished their training and Luaono was elected as the group's president. They have submitted their loan proposals to improve their farms and are awaiting for the disbursement of their loans.

loans.use: to purchase farming implements, agricultural supplies and pay for additional farm help

loans.name: Kompong Svay I Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sidon S. lives in Kompong Svay Village, where she is the Village Bank President. She is 58 years old and a single mother with four children, all of whom are working. She relies on her children for economic support because she is a widow and does not generate any income of her own. Rather, Mrs. Sidon stays at home to cook and care for her children. Mrs. Sidon would like to work around her home in a better and more safe manner, so she is seeking a loan in order to build a kitchen counter in the backyard of the house.

loans.use: To build a kitchen counter.

loans.name: Antony

texts.en:
Antony I. is married to Julia Arguello. The couple lives in Luque with his four sons: Edgar (14), Jonhatan (12), Juan (11) and Luz (9). Since Antony has a big family, he needs to work very hard to feed them and to send his four children to school.

Twenty years ago, Antony started working in construction as a director. Today, he maintains the position. Antony has become a client of Fundacion Paraguaya when he contacted his friends and convinced them to form a committee of entrepreneuring men called “San Miguel”. Because of his punctual repayments in previous loans, Antony is considered a very trustworthy costumer by Fundacion Paraguaya.

Antony’s biggest wish is to finish the construction of his house. That is why he is requesting the credit.

loans.use: Purchase of materials and tools for construction.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
D. Gulbahor is 39 years old. She is married and is the loving mother of six children.
Gulbahor is a market vendor and sells clothing for kids. With 6 years experience and good taste, Gulbahor has made her business stable and successful. Thanks to her business's income, Gulbahor is able to contribute considerably to the family budget and help her husband support their family and his parents.  Gulbahor would like to purchase clothing for kids for the summer season. For this she needs additional funding. She requests 250 $ US Dollars for the term of 3 months. She hopes to increase her income and be able to send her elder son to University. Gulbahor promises to pay the loan in time and thanks everyone for supporting her.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing for kids in order to increase inventory.

loans.name: Bumi

texts.en: Bumi B. sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. Bumi is 40 years old and married with four children. The family lives in Shibiri, Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for the past seven years. She is a LAPO client.  She is requesting for the loan amount of $700 to buy more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sales

loans.name: Asya's Mwanzo Mgumu Group

texts.en:
Asya is 40 years old, married, and the mother of five children between the ages of 10 and 25. She has been selling bites (snacks) since 2005. Every day, she works from 7am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Asya now hopes for a loan to buy more items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses selling bread, juice, charcoal, and firewood.

loans.use: To buy more inventory.

loans.name: Namoz

texts.ru: Абдурахмонов Намоз житель  города Турсунзаде. Возраст 37 лет, женат , имеет 4 детей. На местном рынке города Турсунзаде имеет небольшую торговую точку,где торгует продуктами питания. Имеет опыт в бизнесе более 3 лет. В данный момент хочет увеличить ассортимент товара, для чего ему нужны деньги. Намоз решил взять кредит сроком на 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Namoz A. lives in the city of Tursunzoda. He is 37 years old, married, and has four children. At the local Tursunzoda market he has a small stall where he sells foodstuffs. This has been his sphere of business for three years. Now he wants to expand his inventory, and to do that he needs money. Namoz decided to take out a 10-month loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Market stall inventory expansion

loans.name: Mirtha

texts.es:
La Sra. Mirta F. tiene 36 años de edad y esta casada con el señor Sr. Juan Cabrera de 38 años. El matrimonio tiene 4 hijos, un varón y tres nenas.

Doña Mirta es comerciante y esta al frente de una despensa, la cual abrió con un pequeño ahorro con el que contaba de una cosecha de algodón que tuvo cuando era agricultora. Actualmente siguen con la misma despensa pero además se dedica a la venta de huevos al por mayor, cabe mencionar que su mayor fuente de ingreso proviene de esta actividad.

El préstamo otorgado será destinado a la compra de huevos ya que tiene muchos clientes nuevos a quienes desea proveer de dicho producto en forma mayorista. En el futuro desea ampliar el negocio vendiendo otros productos de primera necesidad.

Nos manifestó que tiene mucha esperanza en el nuevo gobierno de nuestro país, y desea que haya mayores fuentes de trabajo y mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mirta F. is 36 years old and she is married to Juan Cabrera who is 38 years old. From their marriage there are 4 children, a little boy and three little girls.

Mirta is a business woman and she is located in front of a grocery store, one that she opened with the small savings she earned from a cotton harvest from the days when she was a farmer. Today she still keeps up the same grocery store but she also sells eggs wholesale. She says that her best and strongest source of income comes from selling eggs.

The loan that she has requested will be used to purchase eggs. She has a large client base for her eggs and she wishes to provide them with the product as a wholesaler. In the future she dreams of expanding her business to sell other basic needs products.

She says that she has so much hope vested on the new government of their country. She hopes that there will be greater employment opportunities and a better quality of life.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase eggs wholesale.

loans.name: Duk

texts.en: Mrs. Duk S. is a farmer in Thaom Ney Village in Takeo Province. Her husband, Mr. Koem Sotheara, is a policeman who earns a small salary for the family. They have four children, two of whom attend the local school. The remaining two are too young to work or study because they are 1 and 3 years old. Although Mrs. Duk S. and her husband both have jobs, they still cannot support their family the way they would like to. Thus, Mrs. Duk S. would like a loan of $350 to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to increase her income and improve the family's living conditions after she sells her cow. Her husband appears with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del Centro Poblado D. Chimbo, Distrito y Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 69 años D. edad, es casada y madre D. 6 hijos, su esposo trabaja en la compra y venta D. animales  D. carga  “burros”, ella no estudio por que nunca conoció a sus padres y fue criada por sus familiares, por lo cual tuvo que trabajar desD. pequeña para mantenerse.

Con el primer préstamo recibido D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que obtuvo compro “burros” para que su esposo pueda iniciar este negocio, actualmente sigue con esto y también cría ganado vacuno para engorD..

Con este préstamo que recibirá D. S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles comprara 01 vaca  D. la Feria D. Chacachaca, crédito que pagara en 05 cuotas.
texts.en:
Ms Antonia is a member of the community bank "Espíritu Santo” of Centro Poblado in Chimbo, in the district and province of Yunguyo-Puno. She is 69 years old, married, and the mother of 6. Her husband works buying and selling pack animals (donkeys). She never went to school because she never knew her parents: she was brought up by relatives and therefore had to work from a very young age to support herself. With her first loan of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles ($100 USD), she bought donkeys so that her husband could start the business, which they are still active in as well as raising cattle for fattening up. With this loan request of S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles ($650 USD), Antonia will buy a cow at the Chacachaca Fair. She will repay the loan in 5 installments.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy livestock (1 cow)

loans.name: En

texts.en: En H. is 49-year-old resident in Kompong Tom Province. He is married with two children, both of whom are students and are living at home. His wife, Thorn Choun Neung, is 39 years old. They are chefs for a restaurant in an area in their community, cooking all kinds of foods including Khmer Food or Chinese Food. They have much experience from a long time ago and both currently get salaries of $300 per month. H. and Choun Neung are seeking a loan to build a restroom and for improving their house.

loans.use: To build a restroom and improve their house

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị T.   năm nay 42 tuổi,  Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1999.  Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương kinh tế gia đình chị T. rất khó khăn, sau khi tham gia vào Quỹ  được vay thêm vốn gia đình chị đã mạnh dạn đầu tư vào chăn nuôi và đấu thầu ao của xã để nuôi cá. Đến nay thu nhập của gia đình chị đạt 4.000.000đ/ tháng.
 Vòng vốn tới chị T. mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để  mua gà và cá về nuôi
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyễn Thị T. is 42 years old. She has been participating in TYM Fund since 1999. Before joining TYM, Mrs. Nguyễn's family faced financial hardships. Upon joining the fund, she was able to borrow money to invest in raising livestock and purchase some land to farm fish. Today, her family's income is at 4,000,000 VND per month. This loan cycle Mrs. Nguyễn hopes to borrow 10,000,000 VND to buy chicken and fish to raise.

Translated from Vietnamese by Catherine Tran, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising Chicken and Fish

loans.name: Luis Principe

texts.es:
Para mantener a sus dos hijos menores Luis se dedica a dos negocios. Cuando hay contratos para proyectos de edificación el es maestro de construcción. Se dedica a este trabajo desde hace cuatro años. El resto del tiempo tiene un puesto en el mercado, donde vende DVD’s y CD’s. Empezó este negocio un año antes de lo de construcción. En un futuro le gustaría tener una tienda propia, por que tendría trabajo estable y podría trabajar todos los días
